It was specifically so that there could be a [limited] ray and line of light, the purpose of which is to be the source of the worlds of ABY”A,10Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah. as known.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Nevertheless, all the particular specifics of the ten sefirot of ABY”A were originally included in the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, in the aspect of an Essential Heyulie.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: Afterwards, by means of the Tzimtzum, it changes [to be revealed] in a limited fashion, according to the general influence of the line, which is the aspect of the [general] encompassing [light].
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: This is similar to the spiritual life force of the soul when it comes to enliven the body.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: Included in the spiritual [life force] are all the particular specifics of the physical life force, such as physical sight and hearing etc., as explained previously.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: (The matter of the Restraint-Tzimtzum and the Impression-Reshimu which remained, will be explained in the next chapter.)
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: (This then, is the general explanation for that which is written,11See the beginning of the daily prayers, “Baruch She’amar.” “Blessed is He who said and the world came into being.”
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: The explanation is that “He said” in concealment, in His simple desire within Malchut of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), as it still is included within the aforementioned essential [Heyulie] desire for kindness.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: Afterwards, “[and the world] came into being,” [refers to] the revelation of light which spreads forth for a specific matter to chain down, to become the source of all the worlds.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: The explanation of “the world came to be,” is [that it came to be] specifically from that which He estimated within Himself in potential etc.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: For, this is the source for what comes into existence afterwards, that is, the general world which is drawn from the Kav-Line, as mentioned above. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: [The prayer then continues,] “Blessed is He.” [The word “He-Hoo-הוא”] is in the third person. This refers to the aspect of the Predecessor of the world – Kadmono Shel Olam.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: In other words, this is the aspect of [Kadmon-Preceding, which is] the estimation within Himself in potential.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: This is as stated,12Isaiah 46:10 “He declares the end from the beginning,” that is, from the “beginning” of the Kav-Line, to its end.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: The verse then continues, “Umikedem Asher Lo Na’aseh – And from before, [He declares] that which has yet to been done.”
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: This [too] means, from the Predecessor of the world – Kadmono Shel Olam. [This] is also called,13Micha 7:20 “Yemei Kedem – The preceding days.” That is, it precedes that which is drawn in the Kav [the limited line of revelation].
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: This refers to the fact that He preceded [and prepared] within Himself in potential, that which is destined to come out in actuality. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: [The prayer] then continues, “Blessed is He who says and does.” This refers to what is actually drawn into the Kav.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: [The prayer continues,] “Blessed is He who makes the Beginning.” This refers to the entire measure of the stature of Adam Kadmon (Primordial Man) etc.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: [The prayer continues,] “Blessed is He who decrees and fulfills” – in the beginning. This refers to the aspect of the Kav HaMidah (The Measuring Line), that precedes Adam Kadmon.
text.1_, 10_Chapter, 70_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the Tzimtzum of the Reshimu-Impression, from which the Kav-line is drawn, as known, and as will soon be explained with the help of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.)
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the explanation of the aforementioned matter of the first Tzimtzum, and the aspect of the Reshimu-Impression which remained.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Although it is known to those who are familiar [with these matters], nonetheless, there are many particular details in it.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: One must delve very deeply into this [matter], for it is pivotal to true union with the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: [That is, the understanding of this is pivotal to the realization of] how everything, even the entire chaining down of the Kav, is literally as nothing before Him.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: [This should be contemplated] to the point that a person is capable of focusing his desire, with self-sacrifice, upon the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, alone.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is as stated,1Nechemia 9:6 “You are He, HaShem-יהו״ה alone etc.”
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: This is [also] the meaning of,2The blessings of the Shema recital. “The King who is exalted, alone,” [which refers to] the aspect of Malchut of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof) before the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: That is, “He is exalted” even “over the days of the world” of Adam Kadmon, which are called “the preceding days (Yemei Kedem),” as previously mentioned.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: This is [also the explanation of the verse,3Kings I, 8:27 “The heavens, and the heavens of the heavens, cannot contain You”]. “The heavens” refers to the aspect of the general encompassing [light] which follows the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: “The heavens of the heavens” refers to [the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He,] before the Tzimtzum. “They cannot contain You” even in the way of a “vessel for a vessel,” as in “He engraved an engraving in the upper purity.”4Zohar I 15a This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This [matter] is further [emphasized by] the verse,5Psalms 73:25 “Who have I in the heavens but You? And there is none upon earth that I desire beside You.” “Who have I in the heavens” refers to the general encompassing [light] (Sovev) before the Tzimtzum, which is called “the heavens of the heavens.”
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: “There is none upon earth that I desire beside You,” refers to the aspect of the Kav V’Chut (Line and Thread), which is the aspect of the general inner, pervading [light] (Memaleh).
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Now, as known to those who have done the analysis, there are various different analogies and ways to explain the matter of the Tzimtzum, which is called “the empty place.”
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: [However,] they all arrive at one general point; that in order for the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, to be expressed in a limited way, in the aspect of a [thin] line [of revelation], He necessarily restrained His essential light, so that it would remain concealed in His Essential Self.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: [This is necessary, so that] not all of it would shine forth, but only an infinitesimal amount.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: This is in order that the light could afterwards be drawn down [into revelation] in [a way of] a qualitative leap of [diminished] value.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: This is analogous to the brilliance of a deep and broad concept [as it exists in the] self of the teacher.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: In order for him to draw [this concept] to the student, who is not [intellectually] comparable to him, the teacher must conceal the entire depth of his comprehension within himself, so that all that is left is but an aspect of an impression, which is like a single point from all the depth and breadth.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: This is not to say that [his understanding] was completely withdrawn and concealed.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Rather, it is like one who relates a teaching in a brief way. He himself has the entire depth and breadth of the logical arguments in his intellect, only that during the time that he states his ruling briefly, they are temporarily included and concealed within himself.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: However, as soon as he is questioned [about it], he can expand on the subject.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Only that in order for the student to understand, through this short [ruling], he temporarily conceals [the depth and breadth of it] within himself, as explained elsewhere at length.6See Likutei Torah, Vayikra (in the additions) 52c and on; Also see Ma’amarei Admor HaEmtza’ee, Vayikra, Vol. 2, pg. 921 and on.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Now, the impression, which remains like a point, is not a complete and true Tzimtzum (withdrawal).
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: [A true and complete Tzimtzum] would be like one who completely withdraws [revelation] and completely conceals, [in which case] the student lacks all [revelation].
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: Rather, [the explanation of] the matter is that included in this short [ruling] is the entire length. Not a single thing is missing, not even half a thing.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: This is similar to how the short rulings of the Mishnah include the entire length of the logical debate of the Talmud.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This is [likewise] similar to how the entire logical debate is not concealed from one who knows it, even when he reviews it to himself briefly.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: We find that his knowledge of the length encompasses the entire revelation of the brief [teaching], in a concealed way.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: [However,] it is not completely withdrawn, as [in the case of] forgetfulness or the like, as explained elsewhere at length.7See Likutei Torah, Vayikra (in the additions) 53c; Also see Sefer HaMa’amarim 5647, pg. 48.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: The second type of analogy, which is the life of the soul [as it is invested] in the body, also brings out the same point as above.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This is that in order for there to be a change from the essential spiritual life of the soul, to a [physical] life of flesh, it is necessary for there to be an initial concealment and contraction of the light of the soul.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: This is because there is no comparison between them.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Nonetheless, the soul is affected by the occurrences of the body.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Therefore, even the light of the physical life [force] is connected and bound with the spiritual light of the essence.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: This is similar to [how the aforementioned] physical growth is bound to the spiritual power of growth.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: However, when one’s [physical] limb becomes severed, God forbid, this does not cause a loss to the spiritual light and life force of that limb.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Proof of this is [the fact that] a blind person can give birth to a whole person, as known.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: This [shows that] the spiritual [life force] is merely concealed, but still exists, hovering over the physical life force of the body.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: This is called “Tzelem Ish – The form of man.”
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: This is similar to how the aforementioned [breadth and length of] knowledge, which is concealed, [encompasses the brief teaching] etc. (This is all explained elsewhere at length.)
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: Likewise, when the spiritual power of movement comes into an [actual] physical movement, it becomes constrained within itself.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Nonetheless, the physical movement is connected and bound to the spiritual [power of] movement.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: There are many other examples of this as well, such as the matter of having insight into a particular concept, which comes from the power of conceptualization [of his soul], which rests upon him in a concealed [fashion].
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: However, [we must now] understand the aspect of the Reshimu – Impression, which indicates the withdrawal of everything into concealment, so that only an impression of everything remains.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: This is better understood through other analogies and matters. For example, it is like the blueprint8The word for “Impression” is “Reshimu,” and it is worthy to note that this shares the same root as “Blueprint – Roshem.” that the architect drafts.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: He is capable of constructing the [entire] building from the small lines of the blueprint. The entire length of the construction is included briefly in the blueprint.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Another example [of a Reshimu-impression] is like someone who makes a sign [for himself] as a memory aide.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: The sign [or mnemonic] has no [actual] relation to the essence of the matter, but is merely a memory aide, as stated,9Jeremiah 31:20 “Make signs for yourself.”
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: This is a much greater concealment than the [aforementioned analogy of someone who] teaches the summary of the law, which includes the entire [logic] within it.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: [For, in that example] there at least is some relationship between the short summary and the lengthy [explanations].
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: There is another analogy for this Reshimu-Impression, which implies an even greater Tzimtzum-Restraint and concealment.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: It is like a person who throws a stone. The power that propels it is separate from the self [of the thrower].
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: Nonetheless, the entire power of movement is invested within [the stone] in a concealed fashion.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: However, there is a great distance of separation from the essential power [of movement] in his hand.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: In contrast, this is not the case with the power of movement itself, when he physically moves himself.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: [In this case] it is vested within the physical in a more revealed [manner], as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: There is an [analogy of] even greater concealment than this [example of the thrown object], which is similar to the concept of the impression that [one makes] only as a reminder.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: This is like when one hints with his hand to a very deep concept or idea.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: The physical movement is totally separate from the spiritual thought, but nonetheless, the concept is understood through [the movement].
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: An even greater concealment is how the light of an intellectual [concept] is [invested] within the [physical] movements of one’s fingers when he writes it down, as explained elsewhere at length.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: Now, all the above bring out the same point, as mentioned above.
text.1_, 11_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: This is that the aspect of the essence remains concealed and included within this impression and point. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, from all that was said above, we can understand the analogue, as it is above in HaShem’s-יהו״ה Godliness. This is the general matter of the Tzimtzum which is called the “empty place” and is the aspect of the withdrawal and concealment [of His revelation] within Himself, so that afterwards there could be the aspect of an influence of light [in a limited fashion], as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Now, [this revelation] was not completely removed or concealed.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Rather, it is like the aforementioned analogy [that when a teacher] conveys [a teaching] in a brief manner, his knowledge of all the depth and length becomes concealed within himself.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: If so, according to this, even after the entire chaining down of the worlds of ABY”A1Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah. which occupy this “empty place,” the aspect of the concealed light of His Essential Self encompasses and surrounds the entire chaining down of the Kav-line.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Furthermore, just as before the Tzimtzum the light of His Essential Self filled this entire void and empty space, as stated in Etz Chayim, so too, after the Tzimtzum the light of His Essential Self is present, as it is, in an unlimited aspect, literally, except that it is not revealed below, relative to the influence [that reaches] the recipients.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: However, in regard to His Essential Self, there is no change here, whatsoever.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: This is like the analogy of a person who knows the entire length [of a concept], [so that] even while he is teaching his student in a brief way, if questioned, he can immediately respond [at length].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: However, the verse,2Psalms 18:12 “He sets darkness as His hiding place,” and the statement of our Sages, of blessed memory,3See (Rashi) to Talmud Bavli, Shabbat 77b. “At first there was darkness [and then the light returned],” is only speaking in regard to [Creation] below.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: This is because [Creation] is only drawn from the aspect of the Reshimu-Impression that remained after the aforementioned concealment.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of [the words],4In the Amidah prayer. “You are holy, and Your Name,” that is, the Light of HaShem’s-יהו״ה Essential Self, “is Holy” and removed [from Creation].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Similarly, [it states,]5In the liturgy of the morning prayers. “You are He before [the creation of the world, and You are He after the creation of the world],” and as stated,6Malchi 3:6 “I HaShem-יהו״ה have not changed.”
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This is because, that which He afterwards “reveals deep things out of [the] darkness”7Job 12:22 and concealment, through the radiance of the Kav-line, specifically [comes] from the same light of HaShem’s-יהו״ה Essential Self that precedes the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This is the meaning of “You are He,” as known.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: However, the light of HaShem’s-יהו״ה Essential Self is not considered to be encompassing the chaining down [of the worlds] that occupies the “empty place,” as an encompassing [light encompasses] an inner [light], such as the general encompassing [light] of the Kav that encompasses [all the worlds of] ABY”A equally.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: This is because it is not yet within the definition or category of an influencing light altogether, so much so, that it cannot even be [considered to be] an aspect of “encompassing [light].”
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Rather, it is the light of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, which is the aspect of His revelation, as He essentially is.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: This is why we say,8See the liturgy of the Emet VeYatziv blessing following the Shema in the morning prayers. “He endures and His Name endures.”
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Likewise, [the statement,] “Blessed is He and Blessed is His name,” and the like, only refer to the “letters” that He “engraved” in the “upper purity,” which is what He estimated within Himself in potential.9The Hebrew word “Blessed-Baruch-ברוך” also means “to draw down,” as indicated by the words of Mishnah (Kilayim 7:1), “One who draws down the vine to the ground-Hamavreech et HaGefen-המבריך את הגפן.”
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Moreover, [after Tzimtzum] this [impression] too, remains somewhat concealment and withdrawal.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: In other words, it is only according to what is necessary for the chaining down (Hishtalshelut) that follows this Tzimtzum. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Likewise, [this may be understood] according to the second analogy mentioned above, of the life force of the soul in the body, in that it changes from spiritual existence to physical existence.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Here too, there is no change at all, since, just as there is a connection and bond between the physical life force and the spiritual life force, in that we see that the soul is affected by the circumstances of the life of the body, but nonetheless, there is no change in the spiritual essence as a result of a lack of spreading forth of life force to a physical limb, as explained previously, so too, there is no change in the light of HaShem’s-יהו״ה Essential Self, even as it radiates after the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: [This is true] even though [after Tzimtzum] it is [revealed] only according to the capacity of the chaining down [of the worlds].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: For, [although] there is a connection and bond between them, nonetheless, according to this analogy, the Tzimtzum of the light into a [limited] line [of revelation] does not cause any change at all in the light of HaShem’s-יהו״ה Essential Self.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is, likewise, the case according to the third analogy of the physical [movement] that comes from the [spiritual] power of movement (Koach HaTnoo’ah), or [similarly], according to the aforementioned analogy of the insight (Chochmah) that comes from the power to conceptualize (Koach HaMaskil).
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: All these [analogies] arrive at the same point, as explained before at length. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Now, it was explained above that the aspect of the Impression (Reshimu) is like a summary that includes the entire length within it.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: From this it is understood that above, in HaShem’s-יהו״ה Godliness, this is the “Power to Limit” (Koach HaHagbalah) which exists in the Limitless Light, which is essentially utterly unlimited.10See Avodat HaKodesh (R’ Meir ben Gabay) 1:2
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: In other words, [He has the ability] to bring the entire radiance of His Essential Unlimited Light, into an aspect of limitation.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This is the matter of the Impression (Reshimu), within which the entirety of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, is included in a limited fashion, similar to the analogy of the brief summary that includes the whole [concept] within it.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This is possible because HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, is all capable, and [therefore] also includes the power to limit (Koach HaMagbil).11See Avodat HaKodesh (R’ Meir ben Gabay) 1:2 ibid.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: [He can therefore] limit and include the entire Light of His Essential Self in a single impression, as explained elsewhere at length.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: However, actually, [the above] is not an accurate analogy for the aspect of the Impression (Reshimu) that remained in the aforementioned “void” (Challal) and “empty place” (Makom Panuy).
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: This is because this [impression] indicates that everything was withdrawn from there.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: [It does not indicate] that some light remained, albeit, in a brief and limited fashion. Rather, [in truth], only an impression remained.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: This being the case, a truer analogy [for the Reshimu – Impression] is [the analogy] of the short lines and signs of the blueprint that architects draft, which includes the entire length of the construction of the building.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: An even greater [example of concealment], is [the analogy of a person who makes] a sign for remembrance, as previously explained.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: Similarly, [regarding how it is] above [in regard to HaShem’s-יהו״ה Godliness], it states,12Psalms 145:7 “The remembrance of Your abundant kindness” and the like, [in reference to] the essential kindness of HaShem-יהו״ה.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: An even greater [example of] concealment and withdrawal is like the aforementioned analogy of a person who throws a stone.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: Similarly, it states in Sefer HaBahir,13Also see Midrash Shemot Rabba, Ch. 13. “It is as if it was thrown” etc.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: This is because the aspect of the Reshimu-Impression remains separate and distant from the essence of the light.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: This power that is concealed within the impression-Reshimu is called the aspect of the “concealed light,” which is separate from the concealed Essential Light of the Unlimited One, blessed is He.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: This is similar to the separate force concealed in a thrown stone.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: [The force that propels the stone] comes from the power [of movement] of the hand, which already becomes concealed within the self [once the stone leaves his hand].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: (This is comparable to all the stars and planets whose orbit is [caused] by the hidden Godly power of movement that comes about in an aspect of a “throw” from the light and Godly force of the nine external vessels of Malchut of Asiyah.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: This [Godly force that propels them] is a “separate force,” and is called the aspect of Malchut of Malchut, which comes out as separate and distant [from its source].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: This is unlike [the force vested in] the fingers when [a person] writes or the power of the hand as it [applies] itself [directly] upon an object.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: These are [examples of] a revelation of the essential power in [a way of] closeness and is called the aspect of Malchut, as explained elsewhere at length.)
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: An analogy that is even closer to this [aspect of Impression-Reshimu] is like how an intellectual concept is concealed and hinted at through a physical motion [of the hand].
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: This is called the aspect of “investment” or “containment” within a separate matter.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: This is, likewise, the case when a person writes, [so that] the intellect and wisdom [are invested in] the movements of his fingers, as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Likewise, above in HaShem’s-יהו״ה Godliness, the aspect of the Reshimu is like something relatively separate, within which the entire Light of His Essential Self is invested in a concealed manner. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: Now, through all the above [analogies], we have, at least, understood the general matter of the Reshimu-Impression.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: That is, though it comes in an aspect of complete withdrawal, so that all that remains in it is [just] an aspect of total brevity and “hinting” or [something] like a separate power, in a way of great brevity, nonetheless, all the particulars in the [entire] chaining down of the Kav-line [of limited revelation] come out of, and are drawn from this Reshimu-Impression itself.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: This is because of [the fact] that this Reshimu – Impression includes everything within it, albeit in a concealed manner. It is for this reason that [afterwards] everything can come into revelation, through the aspect of the Kav-Line, until the end of Asiyah (the world of Actualization).
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: This is like the statement,14See Zichronot blessing of the Rosh HaShanah Musaf prayer. “All of creation is not concealed from You.”
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: It specifically says “from You.” This is [to indicate] that everything is done [by] and drawn into revelation according to how it arose in His simple desire, in the essential light which preceded the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: [That is, according to] how He estimated within Himself.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: For, with this primal thought that He estimates within Himself, “He sees and gazes at everything in one glance.”15Talmud Bavli, Rosh Hashanah 18a.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: That is, [He sees] that which is hidden and concealed in the brevity and “hint” of the Reshimu.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: This is analogous to the architect’s blueprint. It is specifically from this [blueprint], that he will know [how] to make all the particular details of the entire length of the actual construction, from beginning to end.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: However, in order that he will not forget his [original] reasoning and considerations due to the lengthiness of the subject, he drafts a blueprint as a reminder.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: In this way he will not veer from [his original intent] and he will not have to rethink [the matter] within himself, anew.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: This is likewise the case in the matter of making mnemonics for a deep study within himself.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: These are beneficial to him, in [the fact] that through them, he [is reminded and] knows the entire length of the analysis of the depth within himself, so that he will not stray from [his reasoning] etc.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: Likewise, this aspect of the Reshimu-Impression, within which the entire light of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, is concealed and included in the way of a “summary” or “hint,” is itself the source for the drawing down of the line and thread-Kav V’Chut.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: [It is the source both] of the aspects of the encompassing [lights] and the inner, pervading [lights, of the entire Creation,] from beginning to end.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: This is so that everything should be [created exactly] as it arose in His simple desire and wisdom, in the Essence of the Unlimited Light, literally.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: This is the meaning of what is stated elsewhere, that a point contains two opposites, concealment and revelation.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: It is concealment relative to everything above it, [but, on the other hand] all revelation to the recipients comes about specifically from it.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 70_Paragraph: This [revelation] is the aspect of the Kav-Line, that is drawn from the Reshimu-Impression.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 71_Paragraph: [The Kav-Line] is in the shape of [the letter] Vav (ו), which begins as a Yod (י) and is drawn down, as explained elsewhere at length.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: Through all the above, the general matter of the Tzimtzum [which is called] the “empty place,” and the aspects of the Reshimu and the Kav, may be understood.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [It is understood] that this is a self-limitation only in order that everything will be drawn into revelation.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: This then is the meaning of [the verse],16Psalms 36:10 “With You is the source of life, [in Your light is seen light.” That is,] from Your essential light there is seen a [secondary] “offspring” light, which is the aspect of the line-Kav, as will be explained with the help of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: Now, the entire purpose of man is the deep contemplation of this matter, and the like.
text.1_, 12_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: It is specifically through this, that he will come to the true unity of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, binding his soul to the Supernal Life of all lives, which is the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, literally, for the above-mentioned reason. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the aspect of the Line and Thread (Kav V’Chut), that is drawn from the aspect of the aforementioned Reshimu, in a manner of particulars.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Firstly, we must understand the general matter of [the Kav-Line]; that it is the literal opposite of the aspect of the aforementioned Reshimu-Impression.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: This is because a point indicates the concealment and withdrawal of everything, so that only a single point remains.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Moreover, this point or impression specifically indicates the aspect of the absence of spreading forth below.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: In other words, the matter [of a point] is the absence of extension and revelation to a length and width.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is like the form of the letter Yod (י) which has no inner space, as known.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Now, regarding the matter of the Tzimtzum of [the Reshimu] from above, in other words, that [everything] remains in the aspect of a point alone, it is possible that its opposite can come from this.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: This is because, the result of the [Tzimtzim] is that everything becomes included in the [Reshimu] in a brief and “hinted” manner, and the like.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: On the contrary, this is the main cause of all revelation of influence [from the Reshimu], as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: However, at first glance, the fact that this point indicates a complete absence of spreading forth below, certainly could be considered to be a complete and true Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: [That is,] it completely hides and conceals, making it impossible for light to come and [be revealed] below.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This being the case, how is it possible that the opposite [of this point], which is the drawing down and spreading forth of the Kav – line, can be drawn from it?
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Rather, as known, the [explanation of the] matter is that, in truth, a point and a line are not two opposites, for a line is drawn from a point, and by the joining of many points, a line is made.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Rather, the [explanation of the] matter, as known, is that a point is like a Heyulie relative to a line (Kav).
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: It [therefore] is similar to every [type] of Heyulie or simple substance.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: [This is to say that] though [a Heyulie] is specifically in a state of the absence of spreading forth, nonetheless, this is not at all by necessity, but only because of what a Heyulie essentially is, in that as of yet, it is higher than the aspect of spreading forth.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: It thus has not [yet] descended from its essential state.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: [For example,] this is like the Heyulie of the life-force of an animal to enliven [the body] in a revealed fashion, as it still is included in its essential self, in that it has yet to spread forth to enliven [the body].
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Similarly, it is like the Heyulie-ability of movement as it is in the essential self, before it spreads forth to move.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: And is likewise like the power of growth before it spreads forth to cause growth
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: And like the power of intellect before it spreads forth to conceptualize, and there are many other similar examples.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: It therefore is understood that, in and of itself, this absence of spreading forth cannot be called a true Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: On the contrary, it is the essential Heyulie power, from which everything is revealed and spreads forth.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: In a similar manner we may understand the aspect of a point relative to a line.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: [That is], its lack of spreading forth is only because, as of yet, it is an essential aspect, and is above the aspect of “spreading forth.”
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Now, although [the Reshimu] comes about through the Tzimtzum of everything, so that nothing remains except for a single point, as mentioned above, however, this itself indicates that the entire aspect of the Essential Self is included in it.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Since this is the case, it therefore does not spread forth downward.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is analogous to a Talmid (student) in the presence of his Rebbe.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: As long as he is preoccupied with absorbing [the teachings] and is [focused], similar to a point, with a concentration (Tzimtzum) of his whole essence, he cannot “give out” by influencing his fellow [with explanations of the teachings].
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: However, after he has received [the teachings], the opposite [is true].
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: For it is from this very Tzimtzum, in that he was [focused] like a point, that all the influence spreads forth and is drawn out to his fellow, as explained elsewhere.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: From all this we understand that the line which extends from the point, is just like the aspect of spreading forth from an essential Heyulie.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: However, [in regard to] the fact that it is drawn out in an aspect of a “short line,” it is explained elsewhere that just as a point is the aspect of a Heyulie relative to a line, likewise, a line is the aspect of a Heyulie relative to the aspects of the length and breadth of a plane.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: For as known, although the line-Kav comes in an aspect of being drawn down and spreading from above to below, nonetheless, it is not [yet] a specific manner of drawing down [or revelation] at all.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Rather, it only is that the light has been drawn from above to below.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: It is through this that the aspects of “above” and “below,” from influencer to recipient, comes about.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: This is not the case in regard to the Heyulie of a point, in which there is no up or down, beginning, middle, or end, as known.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: (This is the [meaning] of the statement in Etz Chayim,1Etz Chayim, Drush Igullim V’Yosher, Shaar 1, Anaf 2 that the whole essential [purpose of the] radiance of the line-Kav is solely to bring about the aspects of “up” and “down,” as will be explained.)
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: This [Kav] is analogous to a “Builder’s Rod,” which is not [counted] into the measurements of the length and width of the area of the building itself.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: Nonetheless, with [the builder’s rod, the builder] measures all the measurements of the length and width [of the building].
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: [However, the builder’s rod] itself is only like a short line which includes all possible measurements of length and width.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Thus, the form of the Kav-Line is an aspect of a Heyulie relative to the plane of the letters and gives them their length and width, such as the lines of the letter Beit-ב, as stated elsewhere.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: According to this, even the beginning of the extension of the line from the point, although it comes in an aspect of spreading forth and drawing down, nonetheless, it still is in an aspect of a Heyulie, in that it includes many ways that length and width may be drawn out within measure.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: This is why it is called the Kav HaMidah – The Measuring Line, as is known.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: This is indicated by its form, which in essence is short, and merely issues from above to below.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: Nonetheless, included within this issuance is everything that was concealed in the Heyulie of the point, except that it [now] comes in a way of being drawn down.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: This [ability] comes from the power of the essential light that is concealed in the Essential Self of the Influencer, before being concentrated (Tzimtzum) into a single point.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: However, now it comes [into revelation] solely by way of a line, and not as it [originally] was in the Essence of the Influencer, where it was with the great expanse of His actual Essential Self.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: In this Kav-line, the light of the Essential Self only comes according to the capacity of the recipients.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: However, it nonetheless possesses a likeness to the light of the Essential Self that is concealed in the point, except that it [now] comes [into revelation] in a manner of being drawn down.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: It therefore comes in the form of a Kav-line.
text.1_, 13_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: This [Kav-line] is the aspect of a Heyulie for all the light and influence [given] to the recipients. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, the analogue of all of the above may be understood regarding the aspect of the impression-Reshimu which remained in the aforementioned “void” and “empty space.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: (This is the Yod-י of Sa”G-ס״ג (יו״ד ה״י וא״ו ה״י) of the Upper Purity, as stated in the book Emek HaMelech.)1See Emek HaMelech – Shaar “Yod of the name of Sa”G-ס״ג.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the Heyulie, which includes everything that will [afterwards] branch out from it [into revelation] by means of the Kav V’Chut – Line and Thread.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Now, although all the Light of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, was concealed until only the aspect of an impression remained, nonetheless, as mentioned above, specifically through this Tzimtzum, everything is certainly included in it in short form.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Furthermore, although [the point of the Reshimu] indicates the absence of spreading down, [nonetheless] this is not an aspect of total Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: It is only because it is an [essential] Heyulie power [that it does not spread down], as explained above.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Rather, since it is a power that restrains the entire original light, therefore it does not spread forth except by way of a line, according to the manner [necessary] for influence, as mention before.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Nevertheless, from the above it is understood that this line-Kav possesses the power of the original [Limitless] Light that preceded the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: [Furthermore, this light] is [still] literally in an aspect of Limitlessness, except that it comes by way of a line, according to the manner [in which] the recipients [are capable of receiving].
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Through this we may understand the verse,2Psalms 186:2, “With You is the source of life, in Your light is seen light.” “In Your light is light seen.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: [This is a secondary light,] a radiance of a radiance, which is called an “offspring light.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: For, [although] after the Tzimtzum the light breaks through by way of a mere line, it nevertheless comes from “Your” essential light, since everything is included within the Reshimu, and it is from [the Reshimu] that the Kav-Line is drawn.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: [The Kav-line] is an aspect of a Heyulie for all the influence [of the chaining down of the worlds], and [it] brings about the dimensions of “up” and “down,” as stated in Etz Chayim.3Etz Chayim, Drush Igullim V’Yosher, Shaar 1, Anaf 2.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: For this reason, we may [now] understand the answer to two [seemingly paradoxical] opposites that are found in this Kav-Line.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: The first [aspect of the Kav-line] is that it has the power to “include the left in the right etc.”4See Zohar, beginning of Parshat Korach.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the inter-inclusions and unifications of all the lights which branch out, from Keter of Adam Kadmon until Malchut of Atzilut.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: It is specifically through [the Kav-line] that [it is possible for] a light to be exchanged into a vessel which is not its own, such as the light of Chessed-Kindness [being invested in] the vessel of Gevurah-Sternness.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: This is in accordance to what is explained elsewhere at length in regard to the matter of the letter Vav (ו) of the word “The Awesome One-VeHanora-והנורא.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: The second [aspect of the Kav] is that it is specifically called the “Measuring Line,” in that it gives measure to all lights and vessels.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: This is as we previously explained regarding the matter of the Kav-line, that it is called the “Builders Rod.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: [Now], at first glance, this seems to be the opposite of inter-inclusion [and unification] etc.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: However, [the explanation of] the matter is that both [these aspects of the Kav-line] are true.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Quite the contrary, the [two] are interdependent.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: This is because the root of this Kav comes from the original power of the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, which preceded the Tzimzum.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is as explained above regarding the matter that “In Your light,” specifically, “light is seen,” [referring to the light] of this Kav-line.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Certainly, it is within the power of the essential light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, to make inter-inclusions and unifications of all opposites throughout the entire chaining down [of the worlds], from the “top” of Adam Kadmon, until Malchut of Atzilut.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This is in accordance with the statement,5Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar, 17a. “You are He who unifies them and binds them… You are He, inside and out.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is also the [explanation of the] matter of “the name of Ma”H-מ״ה-45 (יו״ד ה״א וא״ו ה״א) within, which is the path of the entire Emanation-Atzilut,” and there are other such statements.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: All this [inter-inclusion and unification] is [possible] because of the radiance of the limitless light of The Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, which is within this Kav and goes and extends down until Malchut, the end of all the levels [of the world of Atzilut].
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: It is for this very same reason that it is within the power [of the Kav] to measure every measurement and limitation. [That is, it measures] all lights and vessels, and all unifications of “influencer and recipient,” [determining exactly] how much the “masculine waters” and “feminine waters” will be.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This [aspect of measurement comes] from the aspect of the Reshimu-impression, which limits all the light of the Essential Self in various manners, according to His estimation within the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, before the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: We find that from the angle of the Light of the Essential Self in the Kav-Line, it is considered to be an aspect of a Heyulie [the function of which is] to inter-include and unify everything, [whereas] from the angle of the limiting power of the Reshimu in it, it limits and gives measure to everything, according to the aspect of the first assessment [and estimation] which was included in this Reshimu.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: By way of analogy, this is similar to an architect who drafts a blueprint, which defines the manner in which the [building will be] built, so that everything should be precisely according to how he decided within himself of how the measurements [should be].
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: [This is done] so that he should neither stray to the left nor to the right [from his original plan].
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Now, although at times it is possible for there to be additional radiance in the emanated [sefirot], more so than the dictates of the “measuring line” (Kav HaMidah), this specifically comes about from the power of the Light of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: At times it will radiate in one way, and at times it will radiate in another way.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: For this reason, any aspect of new light [found] within ABY”A6Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah. comes specifically from the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, which precedes the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: This is because it is from His essential light, that light is seen within this Kav-line.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: At times there is additional [radiance] and at times there is diminished [radiance].
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: This also [accounts] for the changes [that take place] in the unifications of all the Partzufim (Statures), from [the top of] Adam Kadmon to the “heel” of Adam Kadmon, at the end of [the world of] Asiyah.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: An example is the change between the time of the Holy Temple to the time of the exile, and the like.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Moreover, we generally [pray and] say, “May it be desirable before You.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: [This to say,] literally before Your Essential Self, which is even higher than the ten essential sefirot.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: [We request that HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He] should change “The simple essential desire” that has already been drawn forth within the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: [That is, we request that it should be drawn forth] and come into the estimation which He estimated within Himself [for the entire chaining down of the worlds] until the end of the Kav-line, in an entirely different way, such as from Judgment (Din) to Kindness (Chessed), and the like.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: This is as previously explained (at the end of chapter nine) regarding the matter of “I HaShem-יהו״ה have not changed.”
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: [That is,] in the original light that precedes the Tzimtzum there is no change between a desire for kindness or [a desire for] judgment.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: [This is] because of the reason mentioned above (in chapter ten), regarding the matter of the essential Heyulie desire for kindness, which is completely included in the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: [It was previously explained] that there are three levels until it comes to a particular matter, (as explained at length in chapter eleven).
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: When the Sages stated, “[Pray] to Him and not to His qualities” this even refers to His essential qualities, which are [one] with the light of His Essential Self.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: This is because the Essential Self of the light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, “is not of any of these qualities altogether.” This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of, “You are He who unifies them etc.” It specifically states, “You [are He],” referring to “He” who “is One, but not in [a way of] enumeration”7Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17a. of ten sefirot.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: Similarly, the power of the Reshimu and the Kav to limit and measure, (which is why it is called “The Measuring Line” (Kav HaMidah)), comes specifically from the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: (This is in accordance with what is stated elsewhere8See Shaarei Teshuva 87a. regarding the general matter of Chessed (Kindness) and Gevurah (Might) within the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: [It explains there] that [the Gevurah of His Essential Self] is the power of limitation, to limit and conceal, [thus withdrawing into] Himself [in a way of] elevation after elevation, endlessly and without measurement.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: This is the meaning of the statement,9See Zohar Chadash, Yitro 34c. See also Tikkunei Zohar, 40b. See also Torat Chayim, Noach 69b, and footnote 11 there. The entire statement is, “The light of the Unlimited One is above without end, and below without conclusion.” “The light of the Unlimited One is above without end.” [In contrast, Chessed of His Essential Self] is the aspect of the spreading down of the light, “down below without conclusion,” by means of the Kav which extends from the Reshimu.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: These are two equally balanced lines, and [are both] completely in a state of being unlimited.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: Therefore, even in the lowering of the Light of the Unlimited One within this line-Kav, these two powers, these being the power to restrain and limit and the power to bind and unify, are equal.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Likewise, regarding the matter of changes in the light and its expression, whether [it will be] with additional or diminished [revelation], such as [the difference] between the weekdays and Shabbat and Holidays, or the [difference between the] time of the Holy Temple and the time of exile, it all comes from one power. [This one power] divides into the two lines of Chessed and Gevurah, which are equally balanced.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: This comes from the power of the original light, that is, the Light of the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, from the aspects of Chessed and Gevurah, as He is, in and of Himself. This will suffice for those of understanding.)
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what was explained above (in chapter fourteen), that a line is a Heyulie relative to a plane.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: [This is to say,] it includes the essential power and light of the Essence of the Influencer, except that in the Essential Self it is [revealed] with great expanse, whereas in this line, the very same power comes [revealed] in an aspect of restricted influence and expression [according to the capacities] of the recipients.
text.1_, 14_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: This being the case, even the aspect of the restraint and expression of [the Kav-line], comes specifically from the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We now must understand the specifics of the matter of this Line and Thread (Kav V’Chut), [and] how it has [both] the aspects of encompassing [lights] and inner [lights].1Encompassing lights are called Makifim, and inner lights are called Pnimim.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: This is as stated in Etz Chayim,2Etz Chayim, Drush Igullim V’Yosher, Shaar 1, Anaf 2. “It circles and returns and re-encircles,” (as explained elsewhere at length).
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: [It is] this aspect of the first encompassing circle that is called “the Lower Purity.”3Tihiroo Tata’a – The Lower Purity This is the aspect of the general encompassing [light], which encompasses the four worlds of ABY”A4Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah. equally, as stated in [the beginning of] Etz Chayim.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: However, let us first preface with [an explanation] of the general matter of the Line (Kav), [to understand] how it is the aspect of a general Heyulie for all the many particular influences that “branch out” from it, until the end of the [world of] Asiyah, as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: This may be understood by way of the well-known analogy regarding the matter of a general thought.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: With this general thought, “He gazes and sees to the end of all generations…with one glance.”5Talmud Bavli, Rosh HaShanah 18a (As Maimonides6Mishneh Torah, Hilchot Yesodot HaTorah 8:9-10; Also see Tanya, Ch. 42 and 48. expresses it, this is the [meaning of his] statement, “With the knowledge of Himself, He knows all creatures,” as explained elsewhere at length.)
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: As known, the explanation of these things is that there are two types of desire.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: The first is the simple [essential] desire of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, which is literally included in His Essential Being. This cannot yet be called a “general thought or desire,” since it still is totally one with His Essential Self, literally.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: For example, even if this desire has already been determined within Himself, [that is,] how to do a particular act of kindness, or how to speak or think it, or how to conceptualize a particular concept, or how to have desire or pleasure in a particular thing.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Nonetheless even though this [essential] determined desire is connected to the extension of the desire for a particular matter, however, it [itself] remains included in His hidden essence.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: It, therefore, does not yet have aspects of “general” and “particular.”
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: It is only afterwards, when the desire which He determined [within Himself] arises to come [out] into actuality, that it becomes revealed out of its hiddenness.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: [Only] then does this desire come to an aspect of “general” and “particular.” In other words, [now it may be defined as a] general thought that includes the entire [concept of] the act, from beginning to end, in one glance.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Afterwards, it divides into particular desires, each of which possess intellect and emotions etc.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: [Each of these desires] come in succession to one another in a chaining down, in which the upper [desire] encompasses the lower [desire], “like a circle within a circle.”
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: This [type of desire] is called a “composite” desire, for it [is made up of] a general [desire] and particular [desires].
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: This may be understood through the well-known analogy of a person who wants to build a large building, according to his predetermined desire that it should specifically be [built] in a special manner.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Now, even though this predetermined desire comes in a way of a measured, specific pleasure, that it should [specifically] be thus, and it obviously [follows that] the intellect and emotions [of this desire] come with [certain defined] proportions and measurements, nevertheless, all this is the estimation and predetermination as it still [exists] within himself. [As of yet] it is [totally] included within himself and is as if it is nonexistent.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Only with the passage of time, when this thought comes to be acted upon, do the actual divisions of all these predetermined particulars and various specifications become recognized.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: However, at first, this desire comes in a general manner, that is, that he should have a building with a particular form.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Afterwards, it divides into particular desires for each particular detail.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: It [thus] descends with order and levels, [beginning with the first general [desire] that includes everything in one glance, to a particular of this desire. [Now, the particular desire] is [also] called a general [desire] relative to the [particular] desires that branch out from it.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: [This process continues] until the very final desire and concept, which is the final action, at the conclusion of everything. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: The analogue of all this, may be understood [in regard to how it is] above in HaShem’s-יהו״ה Godliness, in regard to the difference between the aspects of the Upper Purity and the Lower Purity that follows the Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: That which He estimated within Himself in potential within the Upper Purity, is similar to the aforementioned determination as it is within the simple desire of the self.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: As of yet, it has not come to an aspect of spreading forth from the Self altogether.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Moreover, even though this essential determined desire connects to the extended desire that follows it, nonetheless, it remains included in a hidden manner in the Essential Self of the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: It is therefore above [and beyond] the aspect of a general [desire], to be considered as “[a general desire] that foresees and gazes [at everything] in a single glance.”
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: However, the second desire that follows the aforementioned Tzimtzum, is when the simple determined desire of His Essential Self comes to the aspect of spreading forth.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the Heyulie Line and Thread (Kav V’Chut), which includes every particular issuance from the beginning [of the chaining down] to its end, as previously mentioned.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: The first encompassing [light of this Kav-line] is called “the Lower Purity.” This is analogous to the general desire for a large building. [This general desire] includes all its particulars from beginning to end, at once.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: Afterwards it divides with order and levels [descending] from the general to the particular, as in the aforementioned analogy.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: In other words, as it arose in His simple Heyulie desire, to specifically come out into revelation, it included all the particular desires.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: This is the desire that includes [and encompasses] them all, and is called, “The Primal Desire” (Ratzon HaKadoom) [relative] to everything that follows it.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Afterwards, this desire comes by way of particulars, such as the desire to emanate (Atzilut), within which is included [the desire for the] ten sefirot [of the world of Atzilut] in all their particulars.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: However, all this is still concealed, until it comes into an aspect of revelation, when the light is emanated in an aspect of [actual] emanation (Atzilut).
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Following this is the desire to create (Briyah) something from nothing etc. This [desire] includes [the ten sefirot of] intellect and emotions etc.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: [This descent of desires continues] until the final desire, which is, “Everything that HaShem-יהו״ה desired, He did” [and brought out into actuality]. [This is] the final conclusion of everything.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: Now, all these particulars were included in the Primal Desire (Ratzon HaKadoom), which comes in an aspect of influence after the [original] Tzimtzum.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: This then, is the aspect of the beginning of the Line (Kav). That is, it is the first “circle” that follows the drawing down of the beginning of the aforementioned Heyulie Line (The Kav HaMidah).
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: [This first “circle”] is called the general encompassing [light] of the four worlds of ABY”A,7Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah. and encompasses them [all] equally.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: It is [also] called the “general thought” that foresees and “gazes” upon [all of Creation], from beginning to end, in a single glance.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: This then, is the explanation of the general matter of the whole of this Line-Kav.
text.1_, 15_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: All the particular ways that it, “circles and returns and re-encircles…” may be understood according to the aforementioned analogy, as will be explained in the following chapter, with the help of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the particulars of the matter of the Kav-Line, as it is in an aspect of “Igullim-Circles” [and “Yosher-Upright”] etc.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: However, we must preface with [an explanation] of the aspect of the beginning of this Kav-Line, which comes in an aspect of an inner light (Ohr Pnimi), and then encircles and [once again] is drawn down as an inner light. Then it once again encircles etc.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: It is explained in Etz Chayim1See Etz Chayim (Drush Igullim V’Yosher), Shaar 1, Anaf 2-3. that in the aspect of the ten sefirot of Igullim – The circles of desire, the uppermost is the most superior, while the innermost is the [most] inferior, whereas in the aspect of the ten sefirot of Yosher – The upright sefirot, the opposite is true. [This is to say that] the uppermost is the [most] inferior, while the innermost is the [most] superior.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Now, the explanation of these matters is as follows: It is known that although in relation to the aspect of the simple determined desire of the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, the aspect of this Primal Desire (Ratzon HaKadoom) is called a spreading forth of the desire. However, it too is still concealed, and not at all revealed.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: This is because [the Ratzon HaKadoom-the Primal Desire] is only the influence and expression of the Simple Desire for kindness, which has already been determined in the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, that it should come into actuality in a particular way.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Immediately, when it arises in thought how everything should be, it is called the “Primal Thought and Desire” (Machshava V’Ratzon Kadoom). [This thought] includes within itself every particular desire [of the entire chaining down of the worlds], as explained previously in the analogy of a building.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: If this is the case, this entire Primal Desire is still within Himself, without being revealed outside [of Himself]. Nonetheless, afterwards, everything is actualized from this [Primal Desire].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of [the verse],2Psalms 33:9 “For He said,” within the Primal Thought, “and it was.”
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: This [Primal Thought] is called “The life of all the worlds,” from the “head” of Adam Kadmon to the “heel” of Adam Kadmon [which is] at the end of the world of Asiyah (Actualization). This is the meaning of [the statement], “All of creation is not concealed from You.”
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: [This means that] there is [not a single particular detail], even the most final of details, that did not originally exist within this [Primal] Desire and Thought.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: On the contrary, [as it states,3See Lecha Dodee prayer of Friday night. “The end action arose first in thought”]. [This is to say that] “The end action,” such as the end of the seventh millennium, “arose” within this Primal Thought “first,” as explained elsewhere at length.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: (In the terminology of the Zohar this [Primal Thought] is called “Ateeka D’Ateekin-The Ancient of the Ancients”4See Zohar II 165b; Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 128a-b, and elsewhere. or5See Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 129a, 132a, and elsewhere. “Ateeka Stima’ah-The Concealed Ancient One.” This is the aspect of, “The Supernal Desire of all Desires, which is revealed in the forehead of the Holy Ancient One (Atika Kadisha).”6See Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 129a, 136b - “Rayva D’Kol Rayvin Ila’een, D’Itgalyn B’Metzcha D’Atika Kadisha.”
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This is because pleasure is invested within desire, so that they are literally as one.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Likewise, the simple [essential] heyulie desire of the heyulie desire for kindness (which was mentioned previously in chapters 10 and 11), included the simple pleasure of the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He. This is called, “the delight of the King in Himself (Sha’ashoo’aiy HaMelech B’Atzmooto).”
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: This is also [the case] in regard to the three levels of [Yachid, Echad and Kadmon], until [the Essential desire] came to the particular matter of “Ana Emloch-I shall rule,” which is the aspect of Malchut (Kingdom) of The Unlimited One (Ein Sof), that preceded the Tzimtzum, as explained there.7That is, as explained in chapters 10 and 11.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: All [these levels] are the aspect of “The delight of the King in Himself, within the Upper Purity.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: However, “Ateeka D’Ateekin – The Ancient of the Ancients,” which is the source of all pleasures, and [is also known as] “The Supernal Desire of all Desires,” refers to the aspect of the Line-Kav that follows the Tzimtzum. It includes [all] the various desires and pleasures that are destined to be revealed.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: “Atika Stima’ah-The Concealed Ancient One” is the aspect of Keter of Adam Kadmon [and] is the concealed desire and pleasure, as it still relates to Himself, except that [now, after the Tzimtzum,] He thinks to bring this [desire] into actual revelation.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: [For example,] this is like [the desire] that there should be a revelation of the desire and pleasure to emanate the ten sefirot [of the world of Atzilut-Emanation], (It is for this reason that “Atika Stima’ah – The Concealed Ancient One” is considered to be an aspect of “concealment which is at least subject to revelation.” This is not the case with the beginning of the Kav, which is called “The Concealment of all Concealments – Steema D’Kol Steemeen,” for even the thought of Adam Kadmon cannot grasp Him.) or that there should be the desire and pleasure to create [the world of Briyah] etc.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: [The aspect of] “Atika Kadisha-The Holy Ancient One” is the pleasure that [becomes invested] within Chochmah (Insight).
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: This is the aspect of Atik Yomin (“The Ancient of Days”) and Arich Anpin (“The Long Face”) [which are the Keter (pleasure and desire)] of [the world of] Atzilut (Emanation). [This is when] the pleasure and desire become revealed, all of which will be explained in a manner of specifics.)
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Now, the [explanation of the] aspect of the ten sefirot of Igullim-Circles of desire, one within the other, is as known, that every cause encompasses its effect, “like a circle within a circle,”8Ezekiel 1:16, 10:10 and that the effect can never grasp its cause, except in a way of distance from it.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: This may be understood from a desire that becomes completely revealed.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Although this [revealed desire] includes ten [sefirot within itself, such as] intellect and emotions etc., nonetheless, it initially comes about as a single decision, without any apparent divisions [into ten sefirot].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is called, “The General Circle of Desire” which encompasses [and] contains all [the particulars that will become revealed], within it. [Every subsequent “circle of desire”] comes about specifically from its power. However, [it encompasses these “circles of desire”] from a distance.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: An example is the reasoning and intellect for this desire, which is called its effect.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: It is impossible for it to be close [in a way of] comparison, to its cause, which is the desire, because, as known, “desire is altogether beyond reason,”9See Shnei Luchot HaBrit, Beit HaShem 4b, (See footnote in the name of Rabbi Yosef Al Kastilia); Yonat Elem (of Rabbi Menachem Azaria de Fano) Ch. 2; Also see Torat Chayim 63a, note 7. [and, therefore] it can never be comprehended [through reasoning].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: Nevertheless, it is from the power of desire that the “circle” of Chochmah-Insight comes about, though it too has no recognizable divisions into ten [sefirot].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: This is similar to the analogy of [a judge] who, [because he] has been bribed, will find a rationalization for the desire.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: Although this [desire for] reasoning also includes ten [sefirot], that is, desire, intellect, and emotions, nonetheless, it is comes about in a general fashion etc.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: Likewise, the “circle” of Binah-Comprehension, which comes about from the power [of the “circle” of Chochmah], can never grasp [its cause]. In this manner, the [“circles of the desire” for the] emotions [are also drawn forth,] one within the other. [This continues] until the [“circle of the desire” for the] end action, which is the final circle [of desire].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: All this is included in the desire for Himself, until the end action which is the innermost [circle of desire] etc.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Likewise, this is how it is in the aforementioned concealed desire, which is called the Primal Desire (Ratzon HaKadoom), the source of all the desires [for the entire chaining down of the worlds].
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: It includes ten sefirot, one circle [of desire] within the other circle [of desire], until the circle [of the desire] for the end action. This is the desire for the end action, since “everything that He desires, He does” in actuality.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: The aforementioned Primal Desire (Ratzon HaKadoom) is the uppermost circle [of desire], that includes [and encompasses] everything [that is desired in the entire chaining down of the worlds.]
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: [Now, all this is in the aspect of desire], however, when this desire in Himself comes to be actualized, it is the other way around.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: [This is to say that] the desire becomes concealed and invested in the intellect, and the intellect encompasses it.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: Then the intellect becomes concealed and invested in the emotions, one within the other, until the end action, which is the uppermost.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: In other words, invested within the actual power of the action are the thoughts. Invested within the thoughts are the emotions. Invested within the emotions are Chochmah-Insight and Binah-Comprehension, and invested within Chochmah is the desire (Arich) and pleasure (Atik).
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: [Here] we find that the innermost of them all is the desire and pleasure, while the most external of them all is the action [which is the most] inferior one.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: This is the aspect of Yosher-Upright, which comes in an aspect of the upper being invested in the lower.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: However, in the aspect of the aforementioned Primal Desire (Ratzon Kadoom), since it is still within Himself, it therefore is drawn forth in an aspect of Igullim-Circles, in which the uppermost is this concealed all-encompassing desire.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: The first circle [in the scheme of Igullim – Circles] is the desire and pleasure for the whole chaining down [of the worlds], which is within it. This circle is the general encompassing [light] of the [four worlds of] ABY”A, as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: The beginning of the Kav-Line is the aspect of a Heyulie drawing down [of influence], like a short line that diminishes (by way of Tzimtzum) from cause to affect, such as from Ratzon-Desire to Chochmah-Insight, and the like.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: Likewise, from the aspect of the aforementioned Reshimu-Impression, a Kav-Line is drawn with very great diminishment.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: For, although the Reshimu-Impression comes about in [a way of] limitation [of the Unlimited Light], as explained previously, nonetheless, it is still from the aspect of the World of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), except that it is the last aspect [of the Unlimited], which comes about with brevity.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: This is not the case with the Primal Desire (Ratzon HaKadoom) which comes into the category of [expressing] influence outside of the World of the Unlimited.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: However, [because] it [still] is an all-encompassing Heyulie [for the entire chaining down of the worlds], therefore it is drawn out by way of a short line. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: (This is [in accordance with] the statement in Etz Chayim; that the essential purpose of the radiance of the Kav-Line, is solely to bring about the aspects of “above” and “below” such as the ten Igullim-Circles, [which follow in progression from higher and lower] until the end action.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: In contrast, in the World of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), even the aspects of “above” or “below” do not exist. Rather, there is only His absolutely simple singularity, as previously explained.
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: Furthermore, even though [in potential] He estimated within Himself that which is destined to be, it all is actually still within Himself and is literally in an aspect of being limitless (Ein Sof).
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Because of this it states in Etz Chayim10See Etz Chayim, (Drush Igullim V’Yosher) Shaar 1, Anaf 5, and the end of Anaf 2, and Shaar 42 (Shaar Drushei ABY”A) Ch. 1. that it is forbidden to speak even in regard to the aspect of Malchut of the Unlimited One (Malchut D’Ein Sof).
text.1_, 16_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: Rather, we are permitted to speak only in regard to the aspect of the Kav-Line and the aspect of Adam Kadmon (Primordial Man).
