text.1_, 23_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: (This is in accordance with what is explained elsewhere with the analogy of the ten pits which are dug in succession. The [water in the] first is drawn into each [subsequent] pit etc. Likewise, it states in the Zohar, “He made a big vessel, [like a person who makes a big excavation, which becomes filled with the water that comes out of a spring… He then made a small vessel, which is the letter Yod, which became filled with it from the source (Keter), and He called it a spring flowing with Chochmah - Insight.] Through it, He called Himself, ‘Chacham – Wise’, [and the vessel He called Chochmah - Insight.]” Similarly, it states, “You brought out ten ‘Tikkunim – Vessels’ and called them ten sefirot etc.”)
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: This is because the aspect of Atik Yomin is considered to still be a part of the World of The Unlimited One (Ein Sof).5See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Drushei ABY”A) Shaar 42, Chapter 1. See also Shaarei Teshuvah of the Mittler Rebbe, pg. 104.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: This is because the World of The Unlimited One (Ein Sof) is considered to continue until the aspect of Malchut of Adam Kadmon, which is the aspect of the “letters” of the end action that arose in the aforementioned Primal Thought and Desire (Machshava V’Ratzon HaKadoom).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: It is [these “letters,” which are] the last level of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, that become the Keter of Atik Yomin, which is the aspect of the revelation of the light of the pleasure from the aforementioned concealed pleasure and Primal Desire (He’elem Ha’Oneg V’Ratzon HaKadoom).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Therefore, even Keter of Atik Yomin, and the [sefirot] of Chochmah, Binah and the emotions that are within it, are all considered to be of the end of the World of The Unlimited One (Ein Sof).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: However, [this is not the case] with Arich Anpin, which is the aspect of the revelation of the desire that comes because of the pleasure.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Because [the desire] is drawn to spread forth below, it is called the beginning and root of the Emanations, which refers to the ten sefirot of [the world of] Atzilut, both generally and particularly.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: It is for this reason that the aspect of Keter is generally called an intermediary aspect, which possesses something of the last level of the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, but is the beginning of the Emanated.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Because the lights of the Emanated are in an aspect of “the revelation of the concealed,” they therefore are in an aspect of separateness from the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, as previously explained (in chapter nineteen6In the Hebrew text it says (chapter 12), but it is a typo which should say (chapter 19), as corrected above.).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: By way of analogy, this is like the emotions of Chessed or Gevurah for a separate thing, which come from the power of the qualities of Chessed and Gevurah of the Essential Self.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Nevertheless, it is the aspect of the pleasure and desire which comes from the Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, that vests within everything in order to constantly give them existence, as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This is because, the source of this pleasure and desire is in the Essential Self of the light of The Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, and is called “the Delight of the King in Himself” (Sha’ashoo’ei HaMelech B’Atzmo).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is similar to the [aforementioned] analogy of the soul, which is drawn after every pleasure, which is proof that the pleasure fills its light.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: If so, then this itself is the reason that it is from the particular pleasure within each of the particular [emanations of] lights, that they primarily [derive] their existence.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: [This is true] even until the aspect of Malchut, which is the [quality of] Dominion.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: Were it not for the pleasure in it, it would have no existence.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: The absence of the light of the pleasure [for something] equals the absence of the light of its existence. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Now, all the above is only in a general manner.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: In a manner of particulars, however, it is only the aspect of the first three [sefirot] of Atik Yomin that are considered to be [part] of the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: On the other hand, the seven lower sefirot of [Atik Yomin] become invested within the “Gulgulta – Skull” of Arich Anpin.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: Chessed (Kindness) of Atik Yomin [vests] within the “Gulgulta – Skull” [of Arich Anpin], Gevurah [of Atik Yomin vests] within “Mocha Stima’ah – the Hidden Brain” [of Arich Anpin] etc.7See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Arich Anpin), Shaar 13, Ch. 6-7.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of [the statement,8See the liturgy of the Yotzer blessing of the morning Shema recital. “The King who alone is exalted], who transcends the days of the world.”
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: This is because the coming into being of the desire from the pleasure is primarily from the aspect of the emotions of the pleasure, as known.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: For example, Chessed (kindness) of the pleasure [vests within Keter of the desire].
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: By way of analogy, when a person is in a state of pleasure during the joy of his son’s wedding, or the like, he will then bestow goodness and abundant kindness upon everyone.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: [This is] because of the pleasure that uplifts his soul (for the aforementioned reason).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: During such a time, he may be aroused to grant every desire.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: In other words, even a desire for judgment may be overturned to kindness.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: This [overturning of the desire from Chessed to Gevurah] is dependent upon the aspect of the [essential] point of desire, which is higher than the “hidden reason for the desire” (Ta’am Kamoos LaRatzon) that divides into Chessed and Gevurah – kindness and judgment.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: This then, is an analogy through which one may understand how the aspect of Chessed of Atik Yomin vests within the “Gulgulta – Skull” [of Arich Anpin].
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: Now, the aspect of Gevurah, which is judgment, and is the opposite of pleasure, is what vests within “Chochmah Stima’ah – the Hidden Wisdom” of Arich Anpin, which is the “hidden reason for the desire” (Ta’am Kamoos LaRatzon).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: This is the precision of the desire, that it should be a particular way, and not in any other way.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what is written in books of Kabbalah,9See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Arich Anpin) Shaar 13, Chapter 6. that the early [Kabbalists] decreed and stated that Chochmah is an aspect of judgment.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: This is because, when desire comes according to the dictates of Chochmah, it comes with precision and restriction that it should be like this and not like that.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: For this reason, there are many judgments in the laws of the Torah, since the Torah comes out of HaShem’s-יהו״ה upper wisdom-Chochmah.10Zohar II 62a; 85a; (Ra’aya Mehemna) 121a; Zohar III 81a; 182a, 261a.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: In contrast, the radiance of the thirteen qualities of mercy is from [a level] higher than the Chochmah of the desire, and can [therefore] “pardon iniquity.”
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Certainly [this is the case in regard to] the aspect of the first three sefirot of Atik Yomin, which are not invested in the Emanated.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the pleasure as it is within Himself.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: As of yet, no desire whatsoever has been born of it, except that all desires are destined to come from it.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: It is considered to be part of the general essence of the simple pleasure (HaTa’anoog HaPashoot).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: That is, it is from the aspect of the source of all pleasures in the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: This is as stated,11Psalms 36:10 “With you is the source of life,” that is, the source of all the pleasures [within] the Primal Desire [for Creation] (Ratzon HaKadoom).
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: In the general totality [of the chaining down] it this called12Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 128a “Atika D’Atikin – The Ancient of the Ancients.”
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: [However, more particularly] it is called “Atik Yomin – The Ancient of Days,” as stated in Daniel,13Daniel 7:9 “And Atik Yomin sat etc.” [Atik – Ancient] is a term of antiquity, which [indicates] the aspect of the eternity of the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, as He comes to radiate within the chaining down of the line and thread.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: However, in regard to His actual Essential Being [it states,14Talmud Bavli, Yevamot 16b] “Is there old age before the Holy One blessed be He!?”
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what is stated elsewhere15Zohar II 134a; See also Ma’amarei Admor HaEmtza’ee, Devarim, Vol. 1, pg. 224; Na”Ch, pg. 226; Also see the Opening Gateway (Petach HaShaar) to Imrei Binah of the Mittler Rebbe, translated as The Gateway to Understanding. regarding the matter of the word “Va’ed – Forever” (ועד), which through a permutation of letters equals “Echad – One” (אחד), referring to the simple [Oneness] Himself.
text.1_, 23_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: For, when the Essential Self of the limitless light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, who [even] transcends the time of “Yemei Kedem – the Preceding Days,” radiates within time, then time too becomes eternal and is then called “Atik Yomin – the Ancient of Days.” This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the details of the matter of the ten Sefirot of [the world of] Atzilut – Emanation.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: In other words, [we must understand] the descent of the light from the externality of NeHi”Y1Netzach, Hod and Yesod. of Arich Anpin into Abba2As mentioned previously, when referring to the Partzuf – The complete Stature of Chochmah or Binah, they are referred to as Abba and Imma – Father and Mother. The reason they are called “Father” and “Mother” is because it is Chochmah, the “Father,” which provides the seminal flash of insight, which is subsequently developed in Binah, the “Mother.” (This unification gives birth to offspring, i.e., the emotions and actions, as will be explained later.) and Imma.3Also see Likkutei Biurim (R’ Hillel Paritcher), chapter 25.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: [Now,] sometimes it states4See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Abba V’Imma) Shaar 14, Chapter 1. See also Imrei Binah (of Rabbi DovBer of Lubavitch) Shaar HaTefilin pg.116c. that the “Arms”5Chessed and Gevurah of the Arich Anpin. of Arich Anpin vest within Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: (However, the statement6See Zohar I (Idra Rabba) 249. See also, Zohar II (Idra D’Mishkena) 122b. that “The head of the King is fixed within Chessed and Gevurah” refers to the “head” of Arich Anpin [within] which Chessed and Gevurah of Atik Yomin are affixed. [That is to say,] Chessed of Atik Yomin [is vested] within the “Gulgulta – Skull,” [i.e., Keter of Arich Anpin] etc., as previously explained.)
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 4_Paragraph:
[However,] sometimes it states7See Zohar III 289b; See also Etz Chayim, Shaar HaKlallim, Ch. 5. that Abba suckles from the eighth “Mazal” [which is] “Notzer,” and Imma [suckles] from the thirteenth “Mazal” [which is] “VeNakeh.”8"8 There are thirteen qualities of Mercy which HaShem-יהו״ה revealed to Moshe. (Exodus 34:6-7) They are:
1. E-L - Benevolent God
2. Rachum - Compassionate
3. V'Chanun - and Gracious
4. Erech - Long (slow)
5. Apayim - Suffering (to anger)
6. V'Rav Chesed - and Abounding in Kindness
7. V'Emet - and Truth
8. Notzer Chesed - He Preserves Kindness
9. L'Alaphim - for two thousand generations
10. Noseh Avon - Pardoning Iniquity
11. VaPeshah - and Transgression
12. V'Chata'a - and Sin
13. V'Nakeh - and He Cleanses.
These “thirteen qualities of mercy” are often referred to as “the thirteen fixtures of the beard of Arich Anpin.” The eighth and thirteenth qualities, “Notzer” and “V’Nakeh,” are referred to as “Mazalot.” The root of the word “Mazal-מזל” is “Nozel-נוזל” which means “to flow down.” These two are called “the upper Mazal and the lower Mazal,” because influence flows down from them to the intellectual sefirot of Chochmah and Binah, as will be explained."
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Now, as known regarding the matter of the “Ko’ach Mah – the Power of What”9See Zohar III (Ra’aya Mehemnah) 28a, 34a. (כח מה) that Chochmah – Insight (חכמה), is10Job 28:12 “found from nothing,” and is in an aspect of “Nothing – Ein.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: The light and influence of the “Nothingness” (Ein) of Chochmah – Insight, radiates and is drawn into the aspect of the comprehension of Binah.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: That is, [there is a transition] from the intangible “nothing” (Ein) to the tangible “something.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Moreover, [Chochmah and Binah – Insight and Comprehension] are called,11See Zohar II 56a; Zohar III 4a “The two lovers who never separate” [about which it states,12See Zohar III (Idra Zuta) 290b] “They dwell as one.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the “point” of Chochmah – Insight, that flashes like a lightning bolt from that which is above the intellect. (In common language [this is called] “understanding.”)
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: In other words, [it flashes] from the potential power to conceptualize (Koach HaMaskeel), which is called “The Hidden Insight” – Chochmah Steema’a of Arich Anpin. [This potential to conceptualize] is called “the Concealed Insight – Chochmah HaNe’elama.” It is the source that brings forth all intellect from “nothingness,” and is called “Maskeel,” as known.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This then, is the explanation of the statement that the light of Abba suckles from the eighth “Mazal” [which is] “Notzer.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: The letters [of the word “Notzer-נוצר” may are the same as the letters of the word] “pipe-Tzinor-צנור.” [That is,] it is like a thin pipe.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: Similarly, the aspect of the “Sa’arot – Hairs” of the eighth “Mazal” is the growth aspect of the aforementioned potential power to conceptualize (Koach HaMaskeel).
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: That is, it sprouts forth all kinds of concepts from “nothingness.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Now, the development (suckling) [of this seminal flash], that is, the growth of the brain of Abba (Insight) and the growth of the brain of Imma (Comprehension), comes from the thirteenth “Mazal,” which is “VeNakeh.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: These two “Mazalot,”13This is the plural of the word “Mazal.” the upper “Mazal” and the lower “Mazal,” are the roots of the [intellectual] brains of Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: This is to say that in the potential power to conceptualize itself, there is a root for the development of the brain of understanding (Chochmah) and a root for the development of the brain of grasp and comprehension (Binah).
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: These [two, Chochmah and Binah] are called “the brain of Abba” and “the brain of Imma,” as known.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Now, just as the aspect of the brain of Binah, which is the brain of grasp and comprehension, receives from the aspect of the “nothingness” of the brain of Chochmah, so too, in their source, there is a unification of the two “Mazalot” of “VeNotzer” and “VeNakeh.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: It is known that although the “Mazalot” are called “Sa’arot – Hairs,” that only break forth and come out from the aspect of the excess of the “Hidden Brain” of Arich Anpin, nonetheless, their [true] source is from the essence of the “Gulgulta – Skull.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: [This is to say that their source] is higher than the innerness of the “Hidden Brain” itself.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: It is for this reason that they burst forth in an aspect of excess.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is analogous to the bursting forth of steam from the [pressure] of a tightly sealed [pot].
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: For example, when the potential power for intellect greatly overwhelms the [power of] Chochmah, there is a fallout of excess [insight] from Chochmah [into Binah, that is, from insight into comprehension]. The source of this excess is higher than the actual light of the intellect itself.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: It is for this reason that it states, “The excess of the Upper Chochmah is Torah,” specifically in praise [of the Torah], as explained elsewhere.14See Imrei Binah (of Rabbi Dov Ber of Lubavitch), Shaar HaKri’at Shma, page 57a and elsewhere.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: Likewise, this is the reason for the greatness of the thirteen qualities of mercy, which are called “the thirteen fixtures of the beard [of Arich Anpin]” that come out of the excess of the “Hidden Brain-Mocha Steema’a.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: This is as stated,15Exodus 34:6 “And HaShem-יהו״ה passed before him and proclaimed, ‘HaShem-יהו״ה HaShem-יהו״ה.’”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This is higher than the “Hidden Brain-Mocha Steema’a,” which is called the “hidden reasoning and wisdom for the concealed desire” and is also called “The intellect that is hidden from all contemplation” or “the wonders of Chochmah.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: According to this, when it states that the light of Abba suckles from the [eighth] “Mazal,” this is actually [from] higher than the “Hidden Chochmah” itself.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: It is for this reason that it states,16See Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 134a “Everything is dependent upon Mazal, even the Sefer Torah (Torah Scroll) in the Heichal-sanctuary,” which refers to the unification of Abba and Imma below.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: [This is] the [flash of the] “point” of Chochmah in the chamber of Binah, from “nothing to something,” as mentioned above.17See Introduction to Zohar 6a. Also see Zohar II 180a
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: The [flash of insight from Chochmah to Binah] is what is meant by,18See Sefer Yetzirah, 1:1 “Book-Sefer-ספר” and “Story-Seepoor-ספור,” which is called “the Sefer Torah (Torah Scroll) in the Heichal-sanctuary,” as known.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Now, this is much higher than the statement that Abba and Imma enclothe the “Arms” of Arich Anpin.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: Moreover, this is certainly [higher] than the aspect of NeHi”Y of Arich Anpin as they are vested within Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: [This is so] because, as known, the aspect of the seven lower [sefirot] of Arich Anpin, are only the aspects of the emotional [Sefirot of] ChaGa”T19Chessed, Gevurah and Tiferet. etc.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: These are called,20Exodus 14:31, 13:9. (“HaYad HaGedolah – The Great Hand” is Chessed and “HaYad HaChazakah – The Mighty Hand” is Gevurah.) “the Great Hand and the Mighty Hand,” and in the Zohar they also are called by the term,21See Zohar III 249b – “Toorey D’Chashoocha – Mountains of Darkness” and “Toorey D’Nehorah – Mountains of Light.” “The Mountains of Darkness.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: (This is in accordance with what is known, regarding the teaching, “This gazelle goes to the mountains of darkness and gathers her food from there.” This refers to how Malchut goes up to ChaGa”T of Arich Anpin, as it states, “The ark was uplifted… in the seventh month” which refers to Rosh HaShanah, during which Malchut goes up to “Harei Ararat” which is [translated by the Targum as] ‘the mountains of darkness.’”)
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: These are like mountains that are [so] high that the light of the sun does not shine upon them.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: In other words, this is the aspect of the emotions of the desire, which are higher than revealed intellect and reasoning.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: In contrast, the emotions that are according to intellect and reasoning are called, “the Mountains of Light,” since Chochmah is called “Light.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: However, the emotions of the desire are called “the Mountains of Darkness,” [for they are] emotions that are hidden in the desire.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: [Now,] their source is from the aforementioned aspect of the “Hidden Wisdom – Chochmah Stima’ah,” which is called “The Concealed Insight-Ta’aloomot Chochmah.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: This is the matter of the “Hidden Reasoning for the Desire,” from which the two lines of Chessed and Gevurah (Kindness and Judgment) of the desire divide.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: This then is [the meaning of] the statement that the “Arms” of Arich Anpin vest within Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: This is as we clearly observe that the root for intellectual reasoning [leaning] towards kindness and merit, exists because of the quality of Chessed (Kindness) and the great love within one’s desire.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: This is similar to “a bribe, which blinds [the eyes of the wise] etc.”22Deuteronomy 16:19, also see Exodus 23:8
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: Because of the bribe, he has a love in [his] desire [towards this person].
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: He will therefore find justification, and his intellectual powers will be caused to lean from [a judgment of] guilt to merit.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: This is similar to [the Talmudic23See Talmud Bavli Ketubot 105b account of] Rabbi Yishmael, who “took a basket of fruits… and said [to himself], ‘If he wishes he could justify [himself] like this etc.’”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: [From the above] we find that the emotions [of Arich Anpin] vest within the innerness of Abba and Imma, and that Abba and Imma are “worn” on the outside [like a garment].
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: This is as stated,24Proverbs 8:14. “I am Binah, Gevurah” of Arich Anpin, “is mine,” as explained in Etz Chayim.25See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Abba V’Imma) Shaar 14, Ch. 2. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: Now, as the levels descend further, the intellectual [Sefirot] of Chochmah and Binah of Atzilut, only receive from the aspects of Netzach and Hod of Arich Anpin.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: That is, [these Sefirot] bring the influence of Chessed and Gevurah down.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: Similarly, in various places [the Sefirot of] Netzach and Hod are called26See Introduction of Tikkunei Zohar 17a; Also see Shaarei Orah of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as Gates of Light, Shaar 3 & 4. “the Righteous Scales,” even in reference to the lower emotions that go according to the light of the intellect.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: However, the emotions of the desire, which is called “Arich Anpin – the Long Countenance,” are unlimited, like the desire itself, which is unlimited.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: Therefore, even the aspects of Netzach and Hod are in an unlimited aspect.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: This is as known regarding the explanation of the verse,27Psalms 145:7 “The remembrance of Your abounding goodness,” that it refers to the aspect of Yesod of Arich Anpin.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: This is likewise the case in the verses, “In Your great goodness”28See the liturgy of the Morning prayers. and “If he will redeem you, good”29Ruth 3:13 and “Great goodness for the house of Israel,”30Isaiah 63:16 and the like.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: In contrast, the aspect of Yesod of “Zeir Anpin – the Small Countenance” is the aspect of the emotions that are born of Binah – Comprehension.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: They are in an aspect of great immaturity.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what is explained elsewhere regarding the matter of,31Psalms 92:13 “The righteous [shall flourish] like the palm tree,” [that this] refers to the aspect of Yesod of Zeir Anpin.
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: [In contrast, the continuation of the verse is,] “He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon,” which refers to the aspect of Yesod of Atik Yomin and Arich Anpin, [which is in an infinite aspect.]
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: Similarly, it states regarding King Solomon,32Kings I 5:13 “He spoke [of trees,] from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop [that springs out of the wall].” [The hyssop] refers to the aspect of the smallness of Yesod of Zeir Anpin, as it is in Malchut, which is called33See Zohar I 228b and Zohar II 133a. “a wall.”
text.1_, 24_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: (As is known in the [Kabbalistic] intentions of [the prayer], “Amen, May His Great Name be blessed,” that “His Name” (Shmo-שמו-346) has the same numerical value as “Desire” (Ratzon-רצון-346). [Moreover,] “His Great Name” refers to the aspect of Yesod and Malchut of Arich Anpin, in that they should be “drawn down” into Abba, Imma, Zeir Anpin, and Nukvah, so that the “right” overpowers the “left.” This is like [the statement,] “In Your great goodness, let your fierce anger turn away from Your people etc.” This will suffice for those of understanding.)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the further descent of the light [as it is] within the ten sefirot of Abba and Imma (Insight and Comprehension) themselves.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: [That is, we must understand] how the inner aspect of the brains of Abba and Imma (Insight and Comprehension) receive [influence] from Chessed and Gevurah of Arich Anpin (Kindness and Sternness of Desire).
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Moreover, [we must] certainly [understand] as they ascend to receive from the Mazalot of Arich Anpin, as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: [Finally, we must understand] the external aspect of NeHi”Y1Netzach, Hod and Yesod. of Abba and Imma (the gut emotions of Insight and Comprehension) which vest within the “brains” of Zeir Anpin (Intellect of the Emotions), as stated in Etz Chayim.2See Etz Chayim (Shaar Drushei HaNekudot) Shaar 8 Ch. 2; Shaar 16 (Holadat Av”A V’Zu”N) Ch. 7.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Now, the [explanation of this] matter is known, that the inner aspects of the brains of Abba and Imma are likened to Shabbat and Yom Tov.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is because Shabbat, which is referred to as,3See Exodus 31:14, 15. See Zohar III 95a; Also see Pri Etz Chayim (Shaar Mikra Kodesh) Shaar 20, Ch. 1. “Kodesh – Holy,” is [observed] through the pleasure of “Chochmah which is a thing unto itself.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the inner light of Abba-Insight (which is the innerness of Atik Yomin (Pleasure). This is the reason for the statement,4Isaiah 58:13 “And you shall call the Shabbat pleasure,” as explained elsewhere5See Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Seder Seudah Shelishit, pg. 204c. at length, regarding the matter of the three meals of Shabbat.)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Yom Tov, however, is refered to as,6Exodus 12:16; Leviticus 23:4 “Mikra Kodesh – It is called Holy,” [which is] an aspect of joy, as stated,7Psalms 113:9 “The mother of the children rejoices.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: [The “mother”] refers to the aspect of the brains of Imma [Comprehension] which receives from Abba [Insight], because the cessation [from work] of Shabbat is also within Chochmah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: That is to say, it is the inner aspect of Abba, which is the aspect of the “Koach Mah – The Potential Power of What (כח מה).”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: [This is] the “[intangible] nothingness” of Chochmah, before it spreads forth to become a “[tangible] something” within the comprehension of Binah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Similarly, Binah, in its inner aspect, is the depth of the comprehension (Omek HaMoosag), for, as known, there is the “nothingness” (Ayin) of Chochmah in Binah, and there is [the somethingness (Yesh) of] Binah in Chochmah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This is the meaning of [the statement],8Sefer Yetzirah 1:4 “Be understanding in wisdom and wise in understanding,” which [refers to] the aspect of the inner unification of Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: This is not the case, however, with the external flow of the influence of Chochmah and Binah, that is, their ChaGa”T and NeHi”Y etc., such as the emotional [sefirot] of Chochmah, which are called the aspect of the six directions of Abba.9The six directions of Abba (Vav Kitzvin D’Abba) refer to the three emotions, Chesed, Gevurah and Tiferet and the three gut emotions, Netzach, Hod and Yesod, of Insight-Chochmah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: For example [this is] the [quality of] Chessed of Chochmah (Kindness of Insight), which is the intellectual power that leans towards kindness, or the different intellectual power [of Gevurah of Chochmah] that leans towards judgment.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: These [in turn] radiate within Chessed and Gevurah of Binah (Kindness and Sternness of Comprehension).
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: That is, it comes into comprehension, with sound reasoning and explanation, either for merit or liability.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: These are called the emotions of the comprehended intellect, before they are born as actual [heartfelt emotions] in and of themselves (as will be explained).
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Now, when a person cannot find a reason in a [way of] comprehendible explanation [for his position], but is, nonetheless, incapable of conceding to the opposite [position] because of his intellectual leanings, this is an aspect of Chessed and Gevurah of Abba (Kindness and Sternness of Insight), [as it is] before it radiates from the “nothingness” [of Chochmah-Insight] into the “somethingness” of Binah–Comprehension. (An example of this is the matter of [the Talmudic10Talmud Bavli, Beitza 6a incident in which] “Rav kept silent etc.”)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: ([However, the statements,11Mishnah Avot 3:13] “Silence is a protective fence for wisdom” or12Talmud Bavli, Megillah 18a “[If speech is worth one Selah13A Selah was an ancient monetary currency used during Talmudic times., then] silence is worth two,” refer to the sublimation of the “Koach Mah – The Potential Power of What” of Chochmah, which ascends to the source from which all wisdom comes, and brings out new insights from there. This [source] is called “Chochmah Stima’ah – The Hidden Wisdom,” as previously explained.)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Now, the aspect of NeHi”Y of Chochmah (The gut emotions of Insight) is the aspect of the “scales” of intellect and insight, as to how this intellectual matter should come to be expressed. This is the aspect of “the kidneys that give counsel.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: (This is the matter of the strength of the intellect, which is called, “Strong Mindedness.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Just as the legs have the strength to uphold the entire body, so too, the aspects of Netzach and Hod of Abba uphold the “body” of the mind.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: The reverse is true if he is not strong minded. He will easily fall [and retreat] from his logical reasoning, [and change his stance] from [judging something as being] liable to [being] meritorious, or from being impure to being pure etc.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: The same principle applies to Netzach and Hod of Imma.)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: In general, the brains of Zeir Anpin, which are [heartfelt] emotions that are below intellect (as will be explained), come about from the enclothement of the aspect of the NeHi”Y of Abba into the NeHi”Y of Imma.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Now, the particular matters of the unifications of Abba and Imma are well known.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: [This refers to] whether [their unification] is in their inner aspect, for their own purpose, which is the [unification] of their first three [Sefirot] before they spread forth into the emotional [Sefirot], or whether they unify to bring about new “brains” for Zeir Anpin and Nukvah, which is only [the external unification of] NeHi”Y.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: The [difference between these two unifications] is the [same as the] difference between Shabbat and the weekdays.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: (In the Shema recital, the [inner] intention of [the words] “HaShem our God-Hashem Elohei”nu-יהו״ה אלהינ״ו” is the inner [unification] of Abba and Imma (Insight and Comprehension), from which [it follows that] “Hashem is One-HaShem Echad-יהו״ה אחד,” [which refers to] the unification of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah (Emotions and Speech [or actions]) as they receive an aspect of additional influence of new intellect, so that they may be able to give birth etc.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This is [brought about] by giving ourselves over to HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, with complete self-sacrifice during the Shema recital. In contrast, when [one studies] Torah and [performs] the commandments without self-sacrifice, then Zeir Anpin and Nukvah (Emotions and Speech [or Action]) only [receive] from an external unification of Abba and Imma (Insight and Comprehension), as explained elsewhere.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: An example [of the inner unification] is the matter of the ten martyrs who brought about an ascent of the “Feminine Waters-Mayim Nukvin” to the inner aspect of Abba and Imma, specifically through giving their [actual] lives over to HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, with complete self-sacrifice.)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: (This [also] is the matter of the unification of the “upper Abba and Imma,” and the unification of the “lower Abba and Imma,” which are Yisroel Saba and Tvunah, as was explained at length in regard to the matter of Binah and Tvunah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: The aspect of Yisroel Saba is the six directions of Abba,14This refers to the three emotions (Chessed, Gevurah, Tiferet) and the three gut emotions (Netzach, Hod, Yesod) of the insight-Chochmah. and Tvunah is the six directions of Imma.15This refers to the three emotions (Chessed, Gevurah, Tiferet) and the three gut emotions (Netzach, Hod, Yesod) of the comprehension-Binah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: [However], there is another Yisroel Saba that is even higher than the “upper Abba and Imma.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: This is the six directions of the “Hidden Chochmah” of Arich Anpin and [the higher] Tvunah is the six directions of Binah of Arich Anpin.16See HaGahot Tzemach to Etz Chayim, (Drush Igullim V’Yosher) Shaar 1, Anaf 5.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: The source for the inner unification of the “upper Abba and Imma,” involving their first three [Sefirot, as explained above], is drawn from the [unification of the higher Yisroel Saba and Tvunah of Arich Anpin].)
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: Now, when intellect is drawn down from Abba and Imma to Zeir Anpin and Nukvah in order to give birth to souls, it then is necessary for the unification of Abba and Imma to be in the inner intellect, in their root within the two Mazalot of Arich Anpin.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: (This then, is the meaning of [the statement],17Talmud Bavli, Mo’ed Katan 28a “Children, [health, and livelihood] are dependent upon Mazal”).
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: This is as explained elsewhere, that this is the [inner] meaning of [the prayer,18See beginning of Amidah prayer. Also see Pri Etz Chayim (Shaar Ha’Amidah), Shaar 9, Ch. 3. “The Supernal God, who bestows good kindnesses, the Possessor of all, who remembers the kindnesses of the forefathers and brings a redeemer to their children’s children etc.”] The “Supernal God-El Elyon-א״ל עליון” refers to the ascent of the inner light of Abba (Insight) as it receives from the Mazal of “Notzer.”19HaShem’s-יהו״ה title God-E”l-א״ל is a title that relates to Chochmah. Therefore “The Supernal God-E”l Elyon-א״ל עליון” refers to the inner light of Chochmah-Insight as it ascends to receive from the Mazal of Notzer of Arich-Desire.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Then, [the result of this is that] “He bestows good kindnesses” through the aspect of Yesod, which is called “The Possessor of all,”20As will be explained later (in chapter thirty-six), Yesod is also called “Kol-All-כל,” since everything (i.e. all the preceding lights) gather in Yesod in order to spread forth as influence to the recipient. to give birth to offspring through [the resulting unification of] Zeir Anpin and Nukvah.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of [the continuation of the words of the prayer], “He remembers the kindnesses of the forefathers and brings a redeemer to their children’s children.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: The analogy for this is well known. It is similar a person who is particularly outstanding in his [deep] insight [and wisdom]. Since he knows the concept to its depth, specifically to the very source of its inception, he is therefore capable of [bringing out] influence from it to someone who is of a much lesser [intellectual capacity than himself], even to a small child.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: [This is to say that] he can make new combinations [to explain] how to conceptualize this concept, specifically not merely [explaining it] as it [already] is [in his own mind].
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: Furthermore, he is capable of formulating and giving rise to entirely new and different concepts, through this concept.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: However, such is not the case in regard to a person who is not so exceptionally wise and who grasps the concept and wisdom merely as it is.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: It is [difficult] enough for him to make the “breakthrough” and grasp it himself.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: However, he will be incapable of “giving birth” to new insights from it altogether.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Certainly, he will be incapable of lowering it and “bringing down” the explanation of the concept, so that [even] a child could understand it.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: [From all the above] we find that the aspect of NeHi”Y of Chochmah (the gut emotions of Insight), which is the aspect of Yesod, that is, the power to influence a recipient, is specifically dependent on the potential power to conceptualize (Ko’ach HaMaskeel), which is the source from which all concepts are “hewn” from “nothing” to “something.”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: This is likewise so in regard to the birth of souls from the aspect of NeHi”Y.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: [The aspect of NeHi”Y] cannot give birth [to new souls] unless there is additional [influence of] strength in the source of its intellect, from a much higher level than intellect.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: This is the reason that for there to be a birth of souls through the unification of Abba and Imma, there must be [influence] from higher than the source of the intellect of Abba and Imma.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the Mazalot of the “Hidden Wisdom” (Chochmah Steema’a) which is even higher than Chochmah and Binah of Arich Anpin itself, as previously explained.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: This is also the reason for the inner unification of Abba and Imma during the night of the “Holy Shabbat (Shabbat Kodesh).”
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: This is because [this unification] is to give birth to souls.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: This is, therefore, specifically the time for the “marital relations of the Sages.”21See Introduction to Zohar 14a; Also see Zohar II 136a & 204b, and elsewhere.
text.1_, 25_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: This is because they are Torah Scholars who are called “Kodesh – Holy” and the source of Shabbat is in the “upper Kodesh –Holiness,” which is the inner aspect of the light of Abba, as previously explained. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, after having explained somewhat in a manner of particulars, about the matter of the lights of Abba and Imma and their internal and external unifications, as previously explained, we must now explain the specifics of the matter of the lights of Zeir Anpin, which are called Yisroel and Yaakov.1See Etz Chayim, (Shaar HaKelipot) Shaar 48, Ch. 2 & 3.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: [Moreover, we must explain] all the particulars of the unifications of Zeir Anpin, which are [either] called a union of Yisroel and Leah or a union of Yaakov and Rachel etc., as known.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: However, we must first have an introductory understanding regarding the matter of Lights and Vessels (Orot V’Keilim), both generally and particularly.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Now, the explanation of the statement,2See Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 3b [“He and His life force are one, He and His organs are one”], is known. [That is,] “He and His life force are one” refers to the lights (Orot), while “He and His organs are one” refers to the aspect of the vessels (Keilim).
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Now, both generally and particularly speaking, the aspect of the lights of the ten sefirot is called,3Sefer Yetzirah 1:2 – “Eser Sefirot Blimah” “Ten sefirot without what (Bli Mah),” that is, without “whatness.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is as stated,4See Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17b. “He is not of any of these qualities at all.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: It is solely because of the aspect of the vessels that they are in an aspect of a tangible existence.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: This is the [meaning of the] statement,5See Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17a and 17b. “He brought forth ten vessels which we call ten Sefirot… to show… and to conduct the worlds with them etc.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: Likewise, the fact that, in general, the ten sefirot of Atzilut are called by four names,6The Divine names may be expanded by spelling out their individual letters as follows; Alef-אל"ף, Beit-בי"ת, Gimmel-גימ"ל etc. The letters Hey-ה and Vav-ו each have three possible spellings: ה"י, ה"א, ה"ה, and וי"ו, וא"ו, ו"ו. The Name HaShem-יהו״ה may therefore be expanded into several possible spellings depending on the variant spellings of the letters Hey-ה and Vav-ו. A”V-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63, Ma”H-מ״ה-45 and Ba”N-ב״ן-52, [is only in regard to the aspect of the vessels].
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: [The name] A”V-ע״ב-727See Etz Chayim (Shaar RaPa”Ch Nitzotzin) Shaar 18, Chapter 2. is an expansion [of the Name HaShem-יהו״ה] with Yod’s, and refers to Chochmah.8That is, יו"ד ה"י וי"ו ה"י, expanded with Yod’s-י. This is the name of 72-A"V-ע"ב which is its numerical value. This name refers to Chochmah.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: [The name] Sa”G-ס״ג-639See Zohar III (Ra’ayah Mehemnah) 246b; See also Etz Chayim (Shaar Ozen Chotem Peh) Shaar 4, Ch. 3; Shaar HaKlallim, Ch. 8. is [an expansion] with Yod’s and an Aleph, and refers to Binah.10That is, יו"ד ה"י וא"ו ה"י, expanded with Yods-י and an Aleph-א in the Vav-וא״ו. This is the name of 63-SA"G-ס"ג which is its numerical value. This name refers to Binah.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: [The name] Ma”H-מ״ה-4511See Etz Chayim (Shaar Leah V’Rachel) Shaar 38, Ch. 1 and 2. is [an expansion] with Aleph’s-א and refers to Zeir Anpin,12That is, יו"ד ה"א וא"ו ה"א, expanded with Aleph’s-א. This is the name of 45-M"AH-מ"ה which is its numerical value. This name corresponds to the emotive sefirot of Zeir Anpin. [and the name] Ba”N-ב״ן-5213See Etz Chayim (Shaar RaPa”Ch Nitzotzin) Shaar 18, Ch. 3. is [an expansion] with Heh’s-ה, and refers to Malchut, as known.14That is, יו"ד ה"ה ו"ו ה"ה, expanded with Heh’s-ה. This is the name of 52-B"AN-ב"ן which is its numerical value. This name corresponds to Malchut (i.e., Nukvah).
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: As known, in the terminology of the Zohar, the ten general Sefirot are only called,15See Zohar II 67b, and the commentaries there. “The secret of the Holy Name.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: All this is specifically only in regard to the aspect of the vessels (Keilim), as known.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: Now, the explanation of the matter is known, that in regard to the statement,16See Zohar II 153a, and Zohar I 138a; Also see Zohar Chadash, Ruth 80a. “There are three rulers above, the brain, the heart and the liver,” these are the three vessels for the Nefesh, Ruach, and Neshamah.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: The Neshamah [vests] within the brain, the Ruach [vests] within the heart, and the Nefesh [vests] within the liver.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: However, the aspects of the Chayah and Yechidah [of the soul] transcend the limitations of vessels.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Now, the aspect of the vessels (Keilim) is composed of a beginning, middle and end. [This is to say that] there is the inner [part] of the vessels, the middle [part] of the vessels, and the external [part] of the vessels.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: [This is in accordance to] what is known regarding the matter of the “248 limbs of the King” which are the nine Sefirot of Zeir Anpin.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: [That is,] nine times nine equals eighty-one.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Then, three times eighty-one, corresponding to the three levels in the vessels – the beginning, middle, and end – equals two-hundred and forty-three.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: [Now, with the addition of] the five Kindnesses (Chassadim) which spawn growth, it equals two-hundred and forty-eight.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: This is the general matter of the vessels of Zeir Anpin, which are called “The body of the King.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: In addition [to the “organs”], “He prepared garments for them, from which souls for human beings’ issue forth.”17See Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17a
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: [These “garments”] are the garments of thought, [speech and action], as will all be explained.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: However, [regarding] the general explanation of the matter of lights and vessels, although there are many very different ways [to explain it], it may, nonetheless, generally [be understood as follows]: It is like the spiritual light and vitality (Ohr V’Chayoot) of the spiritual [power of] sight, as it vests and integrates in [a way of] physicality, in the physical substance of the eye, [thus creating] the aspect of physical sight.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Now, two aspects are [involved] in this: The first is a change of existence, from spiritual to physical.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: [This is to say that] physical sight grasps physicality, which is not the case with the spiritual light of [the power of] sight.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: This is similarly the case with the light of the spiritual potential power of intelligence, which integrates with the physicality of the vessel of the brain, to the point that it is called, Hitchachmoot – “Active Intellect.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: Likewise, [there is a change of existence] from the [spiritual] potential power to move, as it [vests] within actual physical movement.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: So too, [there is a change of existence] from the spiritual potential power of growth, as it becomes integrated and vested in the actual physical growth of physical vegetation.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: The second [aspect] is the matter of the limitation and measure of the substance of the vessel. [This is to say that] it is limited and quantified with [specific] measure.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: An example [of this is that] physical sight [is only clear] up to sixty miles.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Similarly, [both] the matter of active [physical] intellect or physical movements, spread forth specifically with constraints and limitations, until their limited strength expires.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: For example, the strength of the physical comprehension of the vessel of the brain diminishes and expires due to the limited capacity of the vessel.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: Similarly, the physical power of movement of the strength of the arm will diminish and expire due to [strenuous] activity, or when lifting a heavy load and the like.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: This is because of the limitation of the [physical] power to move.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: (This is not the case with the essential spiritual potential power of movement, which has no limitation or cessation.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: This is evidenced by [the fact that] in a sudden panic, a person may lift something which [under normal circumstances] is much heavier than his ability [to lift]. This comes from the aspect of the encompassing [lights of the soul], as known.)
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: Now, this is [the general principle] in every matter of “Substance and Form” (Chomer V’Tzurah).18Substance (Chomer) and Form (Tzurah) is another way of saying Vessel (Keli) and Light (Ohr).
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: ]This is to say[ that aside from the fact that the “substance” (Chomer) comes in [a way of] a change of existence, it also limits the “form” (Tzurah).
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Nonetheless, the “substance” has a similarity and likeness to the “form,” such as the “substance” of the vessel of the eye [which is specifically suited] for sight, or the “substance” of the vessel of the brain [which is specifically suited] for thought, and the like.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: However, the “substance” is made from the thickening and condensation19The three-letter root of the word Hagshamah-הגשמה is Geshem-גשם which means condensation or materialization. Because of this the Hebrew word for rain is Geshem-גשם. of the spiritual “form,” from its lowest level.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: For example, the power of physical growth comes about from the last level of the spiritual [power] of growth.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: Similarly, the last level of the spiritual life force of the soul becomes vested within the [physical] blood, as stated,20Deuteronomy 12:23 “For, the blood is the soul.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: Likewise, the last level of the light of the spiritual intellect, integrates with the “substance” of the vessel of the brain and the last level of the condensation of the spiritual [power] of sight, integrates with the “substance” of the vessel of the eye.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Because of this [phenomenon] we observe that the growth of the [physical] “substance,” always comes simultaneous to the growth of the [spiritual] “form,” literally as one.
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: For example, the developmental growth of the “substance” of the [physical] body is simultaneous to the developmental growth of the spiritual light and vitality of the “form,” such as [the fact that] the developmental growth and ability of the “substance” of the [physical] brain comes in proportion to the development of the light and form of the [spiritual] intellect, so that when a child matures and the light of his intellect develops spiritually, automatically, the ability of the vessel of his brain develops [as well].
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: This is as stated,21Job 32:7 “Days speak and many years teach wisdom.”
text.1_, 26_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: That is to say, the vessel becomes developed in proportion to the light, each and every day until the age of seventy, at which point a person reaches intellectual maturity, as known. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, the analogue from all of the above analogies regarding the aspects of the three vessels of the brain, the heart and the liver, can be understood generally, as follows:
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: The light of Chochmah of [the world of] Atzilut, as it is emanated from the Essential Light of the Emanator, is comparable to the light of the spiritual intellect itself, as it is drawn from the essential potential Chochmah power of the aspect of the essence of the soul.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: It still is literally one with the source from whence it was hewn.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: [This is] is similar to1Sefer Yetzirah 1:7 “The flame [that is bound to the coal],” or like the aforementioned revelation of the desire from the essential [hidden] desire of the aspect of Adam Kadmon.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Now, although this is merely like an indicator or a color, (as explained before at the end of chapter nineteen regarding the matter of “He calls out the generations from the beginning,” that this refers to the ten sefirot of Atzilut which came out of the concealment of Adam Kadmon, which is the revelation of the [general] desire in a separate thing,) nonetheless, they are called the “Ten Sefirot without whatness,”2Sefer Yetzirah 1:2 – “Eser Sefirot Blimah” because they still are intangible.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is because a color is also essential, since it is impossible to have an opposite color to the essence of a thing.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: [An example of this is when] the color of [the inside of] an apple is white, which indicates its essential sweetness.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Likewise, although it is [coming forth] into a separate matter, nonetheless, the light of an intellect or desire that leans towards kindness, indicates the essence.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: Therefore, [it is understood that] the existence of the lights of the ten sefirot [of Atzilut] comes from the aspect of the essential letters of the Emanator, [that is, Adam Kadmon].
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: An example of this is the name A”V-ע״ב-72 [יו״ד ה״י וי״ו ה״י] from which the aspect of the Light of Chochmah of Atzilut comes into revelation.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This name indicates the essential Chochmah of Adam Kadmon.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Likewise, the name Sa”G-ס״ג-63 [יו״ד ה״י וא״ו ה״י] indicates the essential light of Binah of Adam Kadmon.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This is [true of all the names] A”v-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63, [Ma”H-מ״ה-45 and Ba”N-ב״ן-52] that precede the ten Sefirot of [the world of] Emanation-Atzilut. They are [therefore] called, “The names of the Emanator.”
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: This is similar to how the last aspect of the spiritual Form (Tzurah) becomes bound to the beginning of the existence of the light and form within the substance of the vessel (Keli).
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: This is in accordance to what was previously explained regarding the,3Leviticus 17:14 “blood which is the soul,” and [regarding] the spiritual power of growth, and [regarding] the eye and the brain etc.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: However, the aspect of the Vessel (Keli) that limits the light of Chochmah of Atzilut is like the light of the intellect as it already is merged within the substance of the brain.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: [In this case] the substance of the brain only receives from the “thickening” of the end of the light of the intellect.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Therefore, aside from the fact that there is a [profound] change of existence, it also limits [the light].
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: This is similar to the light of Chochmah as it vests within the brain, which is [then] called “Chochmah Mocha – Insight is the Brain.”4See Zohar III (Ra’ayah Mehemnah) 235b; Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17a
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: It is then that because of the aspect of the vessel of Chochmah, it comes into the aspect of a tangible existence of intellect, which is called, “The conceptualization of a certain specific concept.”
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: The same [principle applies] to the spiritual emotions in the “Heart” and the spiritual Nefesh in the “Liver.”
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: This then, is the matter of the “Three rulers above.” These are the three general vessels for the Nefesh, Ruach and Neshamah of Zeir Anpin of [the world of] Emanation-Atzilut.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: The Neshamah, which is the aspect of the intellectual Sefirot of Chochmah and Binah of Zeir Anpin, [vests] within the “Brain,” the Ruach [vests] within the “Heart,” [and the Nefesh vests within the “Liver”].
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: These [vessels] are the “letters” of the Lights of Atzilut, which [refers to] the matter of the four names, A”v-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63, [Ma”H-מ״ה-45 and Ba”N-ב״ן-52] of Atzilut.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: These [four names] are called the vessels for the [light of the] ten sefirot of Atzilut, which limit the light and restrain it, because the vessels are made from the “thickening” of the lights, as stated in Etz Chayim.5See Etz Chayim, (Shaar Ha’Akoodim) Shaar 6, Ch. 3.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: As known, this is called, “The somethingness of the Light,” as it appears in an aspect of a “something,” with tangible existence. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: (We find that there are two types of names of A”v-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63, [Ma”H-מ״ה-45 and Ba”N-ב״ן-52] etc.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: The first [set of names] is before [the world of] Atzilut [within Adam Kadmon]. The second [set of names], which are the vessels that limit, is after [the world of] Atzilut.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: According to this, when a person directs his attention to the [external] names, his [actual] intention is [really] to the source of the lights.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: For example, a person who directs his attention to the aspect of the name A”V-ע״ב-72 [יו״ד ה״י וי״ו ה״י], the source of the light of Chochmah etc., automatically is [also] directing his attention to the vessel of Chochmah, causing it to be drawn down. This will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: These are the [Kabbalistic] Kavanot (devotions or intentions) of the Names [of HaShem-יהו״ה] during the eighteen blessings of the Amidah prayer.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: This is because, the source of the [external] limiting vessels [which are the names of Atzilut] is from the names of Atzmoot HaMa’atzeel-The Essential Self of the Emanator, and the two [levels] are interdependent, as will be explained. This will suffice for those of understanding.)
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: This, then, is the meaning of the statement,6Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17a “[He made ten Tikkunim (fixings)] which we call ten Sefirot… to show… to conduct [the worlds] etc.,” because Tikkunim (Fixings) is the aspect of vessels (Keilim) for the Lights (Orot) of [the world of] Atzilut.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: By way of analogy: a “fixing” for the eye, so that its physical sight may spread further, [may be accomplished] through the means of eyeglasses.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Likewise, the physical organ of the eye is the “fixing” through which the spiritual [power of] sight spreads forth, as explained elsewhere.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: [It is] therefore [understood] that all aspects of the spreading forth of influence down, can only come about specifically through the vessels which limit.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: For example, it is through the vessel of the brain, which grasps the intellectual concept, that [the concept may be] drawn down to arouse emotions in the heart or to be expressed to another person.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: Similarly, it is through the means of the heart, which is the vessel for the spiritual light of love and kindness, that [this light] can come into the category of being influenced to a recipient.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: It is [specifically] because of this that the [vessels] are called Tikkunim – Fixings, [because they “fix” the light] so that it can be drawn down from [the world of] Atzilut to [the world of] Briyah.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: In other words, it’s [sole purpose is] only “to show” etc.
text.1_, 27_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: On the other hand, from the aspect of the Essential Light of the Emanator, [the sefirot] are called “Ten sefirot without whatness,”7Sefer Yetzirah 1:2 – “Eser Sefirot Blimah” as explained before and as explained elsewhere at length.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, [it must be understood], even in the Hitbonenut – contemplation of the Lights and Vessels (Orot V’Keilim) of [the world of] Atzilut, in a more particular manner, that the primary intent is only [to understand] the matter of “He and His life force are one, [and He] and His organs are one,” that in truth, there is no difference between “He and His life force are one” and “He and His organs are one.”
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: This is because even though the Lights are “Bli Mah – without whatness,” [that is, they are intangible], while the Vessels are in an aspect of “Yesh - somethingness” [and are therefore tangible], nevertheless, from the angle of the Essential Self of the Emanator, He actually made the root for the existence of the Vessels before making the root for the existence of the Lights.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: The fact that the Vessel comes about from the “thickening” of the Light [poses no contradiction to this], since the root and source [of the vessels] preceded this.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: This [source] is called the “Simple [Primal] Matter – Chomer Pashoot” or “The Heyulie Matter” which precedes the “Form – Tzoorah” [of the Lights].
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: The explanation of this matter is known, and may be understood through the well know preface regarding the matter of vessels which actually limit. That is, there are two kinds of limitations (G’vool):
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: The first is the essential potential power to limit.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Examples of this are the vessels of the brain which limits or the eye which limits, and the like.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: However, this is still only in potential rather than in actuality.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: For example, in the hand there is the potential power to limit every physical movement, [even] before it actually limits any [specific] movement.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Now, although the actual revealed limitation is, literally, exactly like the spiritual potential power to limit of the hand, which is the root and source for the actual limitation, nevertheless, there is no comparison between the potential power to limit and the actual limitation [itself].
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Firstly, one is spiritual and essential, whereas the other is physical and separate from the essence.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Secondly, the potential power to limit is not actual limitation.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Rather, [the person] limits his strength according to his will and choice, and it is [therefore] not a limitation of necessity, that is to say, [it is not] that he does not have the power to spread forth further.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Rather, he does not desire to spread forth further.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: [Therefore], this is only [that which] makes limitations, while [it itself] is not truly limited. [In other words, it is not] like an actualized limitation, which is truly limited.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: (This is in accordance with what is explained elsewhere regarding the matter of the innerness of the vessels and the externality of the vessels, as will be explained with the help of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.)
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: [Through this] it may likewise be understood [regarding how it is] in the upper realms, in the root and source of the vessels which limit the light.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: That is, [we may understand] the source and root of their power to limit, which is drawn from the same Singular Preexistent Intrinsic and Essential Self of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, from which the lights themselves are drawn.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: For example, the source of the existence of the light of a desire is from the concealed essential source of all desires.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Now, the potential power to limit is also drawn from there, which limits the power to spread the light of the desire forth, so as not to spread forth further [than desired].
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: This is so that the “reasoning for the desire” could come about.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: This is because if the power and light of the desire would not cease, the “reasoning for the desire” could never come about.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: This is controlled by the Kav HaMidah-The Measuring Line, which makes all the actual limitations of the lights.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: In the same manner, it makes all the actual limitations of the vessels of the ten Sefirot which limit, and dictates how they will actually limit.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: However, their root and source, is not the aspect of true limitation, but rather, it determines the type of limitation.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: (This comes from the Kav HaMidah – The Measuring Line, from the aspect of Gevurah of Ohr Ein Sof- Sternness of the Light of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This is the power to gather in, which is similar to the power to spread out, since they are two lines of equal balance.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is because [being that HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, is] “All Capable” (Kol Yachol) [He therefore] also has the power to limit (as explained elsewhere).1See Avodat HaKodesh, Section 1, Ch. 8. Also see Derech Emunah (by the same author, Rabbi Meir Ibn Gabai), Ch. 2.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: It was explained above2See Chapter 13. that this is the aspect of the Reshimu – Impression, which is the source of the limitations of the vessels of the ten Sefirot of [the world] of Atzilut.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: The aspect of the Kav – Line, which is drawn from the Reshimu – Impression, is the source of all the Lights, as explained elsewhere at length.)
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: Therefore, although the aspect of the Vessels of [the world of] Atzilut actually limit through the aspect of the [four] names A”v-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63, [Ma”H-מ״ה-45 and Ba”N-ב״ן-52], which are called “Letters,” however, this is only due to the potential power to make limitations within the Essential Self of the Emanator [Himself].
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning of “He and His organs are one.” That is, [the Vessels] come about from the power of the Ein Sof - The Singular Preexistent Essential and Unlimited Being of HaShem-יהו״ה Himself, blessed is He, in the same way that, “He and His life force are one,” in regard to the aspect of the Lights.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: (However, in truth, even the aspect of the vessels of the ten Sefirot of [the world of] Atzilut are potential limitation (Koach HaGvool), rather than actual limitation (Gvool B’Po’el).
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: It is only when the light and influence is limited to [create] “something” from “nothing” in [the worlds of] Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah, that they can be considered to be actual limitation (Gvool B’Po’el Mamash), as will be explained with the help of HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.)
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: According to the above, when a person focuses his intention on the names of A”V-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63 etc., which are in an aspect of vessels that actually limit, this itself [constitutes] focusing his intention upon the source of the names of A”V-ע״ב-72, Sa”G-ס״ג-63 etc., which are the source of the Light of [the world of] Atzilut.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: (This is the Essential Name of HaShem-יהו״ה – Shem Ha’Etzem, which indicates the Essential Self of the Source, as previously explained.)3See at length in Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as HaShem Is One, Vol. 1, The Gate of Intrinsic Being (Shaar HaHavayah) and on.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: In other words, [his intention] is [focused] on the source of the existence of the Vessels, [about which it states] “He and His organs are one,” as explained above.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: From this it is self-understood that the statement, “He and His organs are one,” also applies to the above mentioned “Fixings-Tikkunim.”
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: This is because the actual limitation (Gvool B’Po’el) is unified with the potential power to limit (Koach HaGvool), which brings about this actual limitation.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: [This may be understood] by way of analogy, from the potential power to limit of the hand, which is unified and bound to the actual limitation of the movement, as mentioned above.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: (This is most certainly true of the Vessels of the Brain, Heart [and Liver], which cannot yet be considered to be actual limitation (Gvool B’Po’el), as explained above.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Rather, they limit and describe the Lights, only so that they may become recognizable as a tangible existence.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: Nonetheless, the [Vessels] are rooted in the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, just as the Lights are rooted in His Essential Self.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: These [two powers] are equally balanced, and literally have a single source, this [source being] the aspect of Ein Sof - The Singular Preexistent Essential and Unlimited Being of HaShem-יהו״ה Himself, literally.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: This is because just as the Limitless Light of the Unlimited One spreads down [without limit], so too it [exists above] without end.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: These [two powers, that is, the limitless ability to reveal and the limitless ability to restrain revelation] are Chessed and Gevurah of Atzmoot – Kindness and Sternness of the Essential Self of the Unlimited One, HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: However, regarding the Lights and Vessels [as they are] in their source, it is the reverse of [how they are] in their revealed aspect.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: This is because as they are revealed, the aspect of restraint - Tzimtzum is in the Lights, and the kindnesses of spreading forth, is in the Vessels.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: This is because even though the [Vessels] limit [the Lights, nonetheless,] all spreading down [of influence] comes about specifically through them.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: However, in their source, the opposite is true.
text.1_, 28_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: The restraint-Tzimtzum is in the Reshimu-Impression, which makes potential limitation, while the spreading forth of kindnesses-Chassadim is in the lights, which comes about from the aspect of the Kav-Line. This is explained elsewhere, and will suffice for those of understanding.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: From the above we may understand the statement,1Introduction to Tikkunei Zohar 17b “If You would withdraw from them, all [the names] would remain as a body without a soul.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: This refers to the aspect of the vessels of the Brain, the Heart and [the Liver], which [by themselves] are called “A body without the soul.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: [The soul] refers to the aspect of the Lights of the Nefesh, Ruach and Neshamah etc.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: However, after having previously stated that the Vessels (Keilim) come from the thickening of the Lights (Orot), how then is it possible for there to be a Vessel (Keli) without Light (Ohr)?
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Rather, according to what was stated above, that the source of the Vessels (Keilim) preceded the source of the Lights (Orot), therefore the Vessels have their own existence, independent [of the lights]. Regarding this it states, “He and His organs are one.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: (Accordingly, a person who directs his intentions to the name HaShem-יהו״ה, such as during the eighteen benedictions of the Amidah prayer, should direct his intention to the source of the vessel, which is the main aspect of The Name, since “He and His organs are one.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: This automatically brings about that the Light (Ohr) is drawn to the Vessel (Keli), since,2Talmud Bavli, Kiddushin 2b “It is the nature of a man to [pursue the woman].” This will suffice for those of understanding.)
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Now, there are three levels in the vessels; the inner, the intermediate and the outer.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: The [explanation of this] matter is known, that corresponding to the nine Sefirot, ChaBa”D, ChaGa”T and NeHi”Y, there are three kinds of vessels.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: The innerness of the Vessels is the aspect of the restriction of the light of ChaBa”D of the Light (Ohr).
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: The intermediary aspect of the Vessels is the restriction of the ChaGa”T of the Light, and the externality of the vessels is the limitation of the NeHi”Y of the Light.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This is the meaning of [the verse],3Psalms 32:7 “You conceal – Atah Seter (אתה סתר).” [The word Seter – Conceal (סתר)] is a backwards spelling of [the acronym] Rosh – Beginning (ראש), Toch – Middle (תוך), and Sof – End (סוף),4See Emek HaMelech, Shaar 12, Ch. 4. because the main restriction and concealment [of the Light] is in the externality of the vessels.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Furthermore, in regard to the matter that the aspect of influence and the lowering of [that] influence to the recipients [comes about] specifically through Vessels (Keilim), there also are three levels.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: The innerness of the vessels is the aspect of the bringing [down] the Light of the influence of ChaBa”D.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: The Middle [aspect] is the bringing [down] and drawing forth of the Light of ChaGa”T, and the Externality is the bringing [down] of the influence of NeHi”Y.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: By way of analogy, [this is like] the nine Sefirot of the Light of the quality of Chessed – Kindness, as it is limited within three kinds of “letters.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The letters of Thought (Machshavah) are the aspect of the inner vessel for the ChaBa”D of Chessed – Kindness.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: The letters of Speech (Deeboor) are the intermediary vessel for ChaGa”T of Chessed – Kindness, and the letters of the Action (Ma’aseh) are [the outer vessel for] the aspect of NeHi”Y of the Light of Chessed – Kindness.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: [In other words, this outer vessel] is the power to actualize the kindness, to do it in actual deed.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: This [actualization of the kindness] has a vessel specific to it. Likewise, the love of the kindness has a vessel specific to it, and the intellect and reasoning of the kindness has a vessel specific to it.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: In most cases, the intellect and reasoning of the kindness are entertained in one’s Thought (Machshavah), the love [of the kindness] is said in Speech (Deeboor) and the power to actualize [the kindness] is actualized in Deed (Ma’aseh).
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: (However, when [the Light of Chessed – Kindness] comes [to actually be expressed] in the three types of Letters (Otiot) of Thought, Speech and Action, they are [only] called “Garments – Levooshin.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: This is lower than the aspect of the vessels about which it states “He and His organs are one,” which is not the case with the Garments - Levooshin.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Rather, [this statement] refers to the Vessels (Keilim) for the Nefesh, Ruach and Neshamah, which are the Brain, the Heart [and the Liver].
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: Now, in the [vessel of the] Heart there are [also] three levels; inner, middle and outer, corresponding to the nine Sefirot.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: There is the aspect of ChaBa”D of the emotional qualities of love or fear, which is called the “Intellect of the Emotions” (Mooskal Shel HaMeedot).
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This is in the right ventricle of the heart, within which light radiates from the brain of Chochmah, which rules over the heart.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: The ChaGa”T of the love and fear is called the “Feeling” (Moorgash).
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the intermediary vessel of the heart, which is the Spirit of Life (Ruach HaChayim) that beats in the left ventricle.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This is drawn from the brain of Binah, which is called “Ruach.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the vessel of the felt vitality of the emotions, when they become aroused.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: The externality of the heart is the “Breath of the Chest” (Havel HaChazeh), which is the vessel for the natural [reactions] of the emotions.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: This corresponds to the aspect of Nefesh, that is, the aspect of NeHi”Y of the [heartfelt] emotions.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: It is this [level] which radiates into the Nefesh that is “in the blood,” which, generally, is a vehicle for the Ruach of the heart.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Likewise, the aspect of the Nefesh in the Liver includes three levels; inner, middle and outer etc.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: The Zohar calls the inner [level], “The Impression of Life – Keesta D’Chayoota.”
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: This refers to the aspect of the impression (Reshimoo) that remains of the aspect of the Ruach during sleep.
text.1_, 29_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the intellect of ChaBa”D in their immature state (Katnoot), [as they are] in the Nefesh.
