text.1_, 48_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: This is because every day new intellect is drawn forth from Abba and Imma of Atzilut to Zeir Anpin and Nukvah, to the point that at every hour and moment there is a renewal of the light and influence from its first source, which is the simple pleasure and desire in Malchut of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, as it states, “Your Kingship [is the Kingship of all worlds] etc.,” as known.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Now at times, the aspect of the ten Sefirot of Malchut are in an aspect of immaturity (Katnut) and at times they are in an aspect of maturity (Gadlut).
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This is similar to what was explained previously about the ten Sefirot of Zeir Anpin; that they have mature and immature intellect [depending on how they receive from] the emotions of Abba and Imma etc., even [including] the ultimate immaturity in the external vessels of NeHi”Y etc.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Likewise in the aspect of the revelation of Malchut, as it is built into an independent stature, at times there is an aspect of mature intellect in the emotions from the aspect of Chochmah and Binah of Malchut. This is like when the intellect spreads forth abundantly in the emotions that are revealed in speech.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: At other times, however, it radiates in an aspect of immaturity, so much so, that sometimes the emotions of Malchut are in a state of complete immaturity.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: (This is as stated in Zohar about the verse,7Song of Songs 1:5; Zohar Balak 191a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Shmot Vol. 2, p. 447. “I am black etc.” that she made herself small and became like a point etc., which refers to the point under Yesod, as it states, “And she fell before his feet” as discussed previously.)
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: (This is also like the difference between the days of the week and Shabbat, for Shabbat receives from the aspect of ChaGa”T of Zeir Anpin, as in,8Piyut Azamer Bishvachin, Shabbat evening prayers “The right, the left, and the bride in between them etc.” At times [influence] is received in an aspect of face to face (Panim B'Panim), such as on Yom Kippur, when Malchut ascends to the inner aspect of Atik Yomin etc.9See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Dvarim Vol. 3, p. 1,105)
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Now, the aspect of the vessels of the ten Sefirot of Malchut of Atzilut is the aspect of the letters of speech of the ten utterances [of creation] and there are three levels in this, just as we described previously about thought.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: That is, thought of speech is the aspect of the vessel for the ChaBa”D of Nukvah, and speech of speech is the aspect of the vessel of the breath of speech [that conveys] the emotions of speech, and action of speech is the aspect of the vessel of NeHi”Y of Malchut, until the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut that penetrates the screen etc.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: The explanation of the matter is as known, that thought of speech can be compared to the thought that becomes garbed within speech, when a person speaks about something, that it is certain that in every particular word, there is vested the particular thought of that speech.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: For the manner of the combinations of the letters of speech are patterned exactly according to the pattern of the combinations of thought.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: (This is as discussed previously, that the heels of Leah enter into the head of Rachel; that the aspect of thought of speech is made from the aspect of speech of thought and included in this is also the thought of how to speak, both generally and specifically etc.)
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: For example, within the utterance, “Let there be light-Yehiy Ohr-יהי אור,” is vested the thought of this utterance.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: It too is called a, “closed saying” (Maamar Satoom), because all that comes into [actual] revelation is only the speech of, “Let there be light-Yehiy Ohr-יהי אור.”
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: This thought is the aspect of the vessel for the ChaBa”D of this utterance “Let there be light-Yehiy Ohr-יהי אור” which is the aspect of Chessed of Malchut etc., for the first thousand (of the six thousand) years10This will be discussed in the next chapter. (as will be explained).
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: And the thought of the second utterance of “Let there be a firmament-Yehiy Rakia-יהי רקיע” is in the quality of judgment (Gevurah) of Malchut, and is the aspect of the vessel for the intellect of this quality etc.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: The same applies to all the six emotive qualities of Malchut; that their aspect of thought is the vessel for the intellect that they contain.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: And the aspect of the vessels for ChaGa”T and NeHi”Y etc. which is the aspect of speech of speech, can be compared to the letters of the kindness or judgment of the speech itself.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is because the word and decree of the King contains these three qualities; kindness, judgment and mercy, that is, the aspect of ChaGa”T, and this comes into the word of the King in actual speech and letters.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Now, the wisdom and emotions that become revealed in it, are the aspect of the form (Tzurah) of speech, which is called the Speaking Spirit (Ruach Memalela) or the Speaking Soul (Nefesh HaMedaberet) etc.,11See Chapter 38 as known.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: The aspect of action of speech, which is the vessel for NeHi”Y etc., is when the speech comes to give a command for actualization in actuality, such as “and God said, and it was so” in actuality.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: For example, when a king commands for something to actually be done, it first begins with a decree in the words of his judgment, that are called the word and decree of the king, that include [the qualities of] ChaGa”T. Afterwards the final ruling comes to a command to be actualized, which is called the aspect of NeHi”Y, and the aspect of the vessel for this NeHi”Y is the letters of speech [themselves], wherein he simply commands it to be done.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: (Similarly, the movement of the lips12Talmud Bavli 90b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 3, p. 910. is also [considered to be] an action and is called action of speech as well, for the essence of the matter is that the mouth cuts the words of speech to come forth in actuality and completion, as there is also speech which is not yet for action etc.)
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: It is in this regard that it states, “And God said, ‘Let there be light’” and “[let there be] a firmament,” specifically in action.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Now the aspect of the action that resulted from this speech, is as written, “And there was light-Vayehiy Ohr-ויהי אור” and the like, is like when the word of the king is really actualized, and this is the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: This only occurs when the influence and light, comes forth to be an aspect of a source for the actual creation of something from nothing etc. This is the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut, which penetrates the screen to become a source for Briyah-creation, as will be explained. This will suffice for the understanding.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: (However, this too is still in the aspect of Atzilut and is called the aspect of Asiyah-action of Malchut of Atzilut.
text.1_, 48_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: For example, this is like the power in the action that is separate from the power of the one who acts, for although the power of the one who acts is an aspect of the power of actualization, nevertheless, the power that comes out from his power into the acted upon, is the aspect of Malchut of Malchut, as explained elsewhere.)
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, it is known regarding the particulars of the matter of the five judgments1See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 1, pg. 237MaNTzePa”Ch (מנצפ״ך) of speech in the ten utterances [of creation] that2Introduction to Zohar 2a “the mother lends [to the daughter],” that these are the five organs of [speech of] the mouth.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: [The letters] Aleph-א, Chet-ח, Heh-ה, Ayin-ע are from the throat, Gimel-ג, Yod-י, Chaf-כ, Kof-ק are from the palate,3Sefer Yetzirah 2:1; Also see Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as HaShem Is One, Vol. 2 & 3 (The Letters of Creation) and Vol. 4 (The Vowels of Creation); Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee Dvarim Vol. 1, p. 105 and so forth, so that there are specific letters for each organ, in and of itself.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: The combinations arise through their union and intermingling in various different manners.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what it states in Sefer Yetzirah,4Sefer Yetzirah 2:3; Sefer Yetzirah 4:5 and on; Sefer Yetzirah 4:12 “And He set them in the mouth etc., He made [the] letter [Aleph-א] reign etc., go out and contemplate that from five letters, one hundred and twenty combinations are made etc.”
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: This comes about by means of the aspect of the five judgments that divide the breath of speech.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: For in speech there is substance (Chomer) and form (Tzurah). The breath of the voice of speech is the substance, which is comprised of fire, water and wind (אמ”ר),5See Zohar II 184b; Ginat Egoz translated as HaShem Is One ibid.; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 2, p. 651; Torat Chayim 39d. and the voice is divided into various combinations. Nonetheless, a single voice unites the totality of all the combinations.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: (This is as explained elsewhere about the matter of,6Song of Songs 1:10; See Maamarei Admor HaZaken 5564 pg. 9; Ketuvim Vol. 2, pg. 89; Likkutei Torah, Shir HaShirim 13a. “Your neck with [a necklace of] beads” that it is like the single strand that unifies and binds the many stones of a necklace together.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: It is likewise so, regarding the aspect of the letters of thought in speech, that there is a single general thought that encompasses and unifies all the particular letters of thought that [come out] in the particulars of speech.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: The same is likewise so in regard to the voice of thought itself and the five judgments of Imma etc.)
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Now, as known7Zohar III (Raaya Mehemna) 256b, 248a; 258a; Tanya Igeret HaKodesh 5; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 2, pg. 380, Kuntreisim pg. 547 and on. “The father founded the daughter” as stated that the [power of] combination is of Chochmah etc.8Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch p. 120; Kuntreisim p. 547.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what was previously explained regarding thought, that is, that the combinations of speech themselves are by means of the aspect of the five judgments that restrain the manner that the intellect [is revealed] in speech, and that it is specifically according to this, that the combinations are drawn forth.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Therefore, the various different ways that the combinations [of speech] constantly change, is precisely according to the dictates of the intention of the thought that is [vested] in the speech.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: The above explains the statement that it is specifically Imma that “lends [the clothes] etc.,” which is the aspect of Binah – that is, the upper Imma – that is drawn into the lower Imma, which is the aspect of Binah that becomes vested within the thought of speech, that is, within the specific manner of each combination of speech etc.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: However, the statement that, “the [power of] combination is of Chochmah,” refers to the root and power to actually combine these various combinations that are in accordance to the intellect of Binah.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: For, we observe that immediately upon the arousal of one’s desire to speak in various specific combinations, one need not delve into the intellect and comprehension of Binah to determine how to combine the letters, for even a small child who speaks, immediately knows to combine the letters of speech, without any preparation for it whatsoever.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: This is because the root of this power to combine comes spontaneously from the radiance of the Koach Ma”H (כח מ״ה) of Chochmah (חכמה) that transcends the comprehension of Binah. That is, it is from the aspect of the power of the intellect (Koach HaMaskeel) itself, which is the source of Chochmah.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: (This is as explained elsewhere regarding the verse,9Gensis 2:7; See Torah Or, Miketz 42b; Derech Mitzvotecha pg. 75; “And the man became a living soul [Nefesh Chayah],” which is the inner aspect of the beginnings of Chochmah, and that it is specifically then that he is able to speak and is called a “Ruach Memalela – a speaking spirit etc.”)
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: This then, [explains] the statement that, “the father founded the daughter,” as known.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: (In this respect, the statement that, “Bereishit-בראשית is also an utterance,” refers [only] to the Chochmah and intellect that is within the utterances, and does not refer to the power of combination that all speakers possess, which is called the “speaking soul” etc.)
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: This then, is the primary aspect of a human being, who is called a “speaker” (Medaber), referring to the power and root of the combinations of speech, in that he is specifically called a “speaking soul” etc.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: (This refers to when the aspect of the root and source of the letters of the soul themselves, come to be revealed in the aspect of the speech of the soul itself, that it is called a speaking soul (Nefesh HaMedaberet) or speaking spirit (Ru’ach Memalela) etc.)
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: According to this we may understand the matter of the changes in the combinations of the six days of creation of the emotive qualities of Malchut of Atzilut.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: For example, the combination of the first day, “Let there be light-Yehiy Ohr-יהי אור,” which is the aspect of Chessed,10Genesis 1:3; See Or HaChayim to Zohar Bereishit 46a; Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Shaar HaKriyat Shma 76b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 4, pg. 1,446; Hanachot 5577 pg. 10; Torat Chayim, Bereishit 8c. is the root of the first millennium of Briyah, Yetzirah, and Asiyah, as known regarding the verse, “In six days [HaShem] made etc.,” referring to the six upper days of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah of Atzilut etc., that are called,11Isaiah 63:11; Deuteronomy 32:7; See Zohar III 15a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 1, pg. 225; Bamidbar Vol. 2 pg. 366. “Yemei Olam - the days of the world” [in the masculine] and “Yemot Olam - the days of the world” [in the feminine].
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: And from the combinations of the second day,12Genesis 1:6 “Let there be a firmament-Yehiy Rakia-יהי רקיע,” come the aspect of judgment of Malchut, which is the source for the second millennium.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is as known regarding the explanation of [the verse,]13Psalms 90:4; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch pg. 398; Devarim Vol. 1, pg. 207; Vol. 3, pg. 805. “For a thousand years [in Your eyes] are but a day of yesterday etc.,” referring to the14Talmud Bavli, Rosh HaShanah 31a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereishit p. 53. “six thousand years [that] the world exists,” which are drawn from the six emotions of Malchut etc., that is, from the different changes in the combinations of the speaking spirit of Malchut, which is called the speaking soul, as in “And God said-Vayomer Elohi”m-ויאמר אלהי״ם etc.”
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: In other words, [the changing combinations] are because of the aspect of change in the drawing forth of the intellect of Chochmah and Binah in the emotions, whereby the manner of the combinations automatically changes from kindness to judgment, both generally and specifically.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: These [combinations] are all according to the aspect of the light of the radiance of Abba which founded the daughter (Barta), for it is the root [of the power] to combine, as discussed previously, and it transcends the light of the intellect of Chochmah within the speech [itself] as mentioned above.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This [even] includes specific [changes] such as how Rabbi Chaninah Ben Dosa said,15Talmud Bavli, Taanit 25a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Shemot Vol. 2, pg. 332; HaNachot 5577 pg. 228. “Let He who told oil to ignite [tell the vinegar to ignite] etc.” That is, let He who combined through the ten utterances of the title God-Elohim-אלהי״ם, this nature of oil to ignite; let Him say this combination and nature to vinegar, so that it should ignite.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: This is as stated that,16Samuel II 23:3 “The righteous (Tzaddik) rules with his fear of God-Elohi”m-אלהי״ם,” that is, with the one hundred and twenty combinations of HaShem’s-יהו"ה title Elohi”m-אלהי״ם,17See Etz Chayim, Shaar 15, Ch. 6; Shaar 44, Ch. 5; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee Shemot Vol. 1, pg. 137. as known.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: The primary aspect of this “ruling” are the changes in the manner of the intellect of Nukvah, that is, the Chochmah and Binah that is within the ten utterances from the very root of the wisdom and the root of the desire.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: This is as stated,18Psalms 135:6 “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired He did” with the ten utterances of the supernal speech of Atzilut, in the aspect of Asiyah of Malchut of Atzilut discussed previously.
text.1_, 49_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: From all of the above we may also understand the general [principle and unity of the] Hitbonenut-contemplation, with all its numerous details, that is, from the very root of the desire in Malchut of the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), HaShem-יהו״ה, blessed is He, until Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut and until the very final action, so that it literally is [understood] that “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired He did” in actuality, like actually making vinegar ignite, and the like. This will suffice for the understanding.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: We must now understand the matter of the screen (Masach) that is between Atzilut and Briyah,1Etz Chayim, Shaar 42, Ch. 13-14; Torah Or Lech 12c; and [that] Malchut penetrates the screen etc.,2Etz Chayim, Shaar 42, Ch. 13; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim, Vol. 3, pg. 881; as mentioned previously.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: For it is known about the verse,3Psalms 36:10; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereishit p. 185; Devarim Vol. 1, p. 178; Torat Chayim Vayeshev, 205a “For with You is the source of life, in Your light is light seen,” that this is called an offspring light, like a light that is seen through a screen.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: That is, the primary essential light remains above the screen and there is only a glimmer from the concealed essential light that is hidden within the density of the screen and penetrates and radiates [through], which is called a glimmer of a glimmer.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: This is like the matter of,4Zohar Bereishit 15b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Shmot Vol. 1; pg. 159 “He engraved letters etc.” which is like the form of a letter that is pressed into the wax, which is only an impression of the concealed essential letter of the seal etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Likewise, it is only the aspect of a glimmer of a glimmer of the aspect of Malchut of Malchut that penetrates and is seen to radiate from within the screen etc., and becomes Keter of Briyah etc., which is the [matter of], “in Your light is light seen etc.”
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Regarding this it states about the creation of the world that,5Talmud Bavli, Shabbat 77b “At first there was darkness and then light returned etc.,” or as stated,6Psalms 18:12; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 3, pg. 1,057. “He made darkness His hiding place etc.”
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: This is also the matter of the Tzimtzum-restraint of HaShem’s-יהו״ה title God-Elohi”m-אלהי״ם, as it states,7Psalms 84:12; Tanya, Shaar HaYichud V'HaEmunah, translated as The Gate of Unity and Faith, Ch. 4; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Dvarim Vol. 2, p. 400; Na”Ch p. 395; Also see Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as HaShem Is One, Vol. 1, The Gate of Intrinsic Being (Shaar HaHavayah) and The Gate of His Title (Shaar HaKinuy). “For HaShem Elohi”m-יהו"ה אלהי"ם is a sun and a shield,” that is, it is like a sheath for the sun etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: (This is as known regarding the verse,8Exodus 20:18; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Parshiot HaTorah, Vol. 1, pg. 342; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 4, pg. 1,371; Torat Chayim Bereishit 36c; Also see Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, Vol. 1, The Gate of His Title (Shaar HaKinuy) and The Gate of The Name (Shaar HaShem). “And Moshe approached the thick darkness where God-Elohi”m-אלהי״ם was etc.” and similarly,9Palms 91:1 “You who dwells in the Supernal concealment, in the shadow of the Almighty (Shadai-שדי) etc.” that is, the One who said to his world “Dai-enough.” etc.10Talmud Bavli, Chagiga 12a; Likkutei Torah, Shir HaShirim 4d; Also see Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, Vol. 1, The Gate of The Name (Shaar HaShem))
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: Now the root of the matter of this screen-Masach is that it is made from the aspect of the garment of the Chashmal, from the externality of Binah, that encompasses until beneath the feet of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah etc.,11Etz Chayim, Shaar 42, Ch. 13; Torat Chayim, Noach, 58a. as previously mentioned.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: This is in accordance with what is stated elsewhere about the verse,12Genesis 31:52; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Inyanim p. 313; 5567 p. 250; Sefer HaMaamarim 5650 p. 308; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Drushei Chatunah Vol. 2, p. 505 & p. 537; Torat Chayim, Vayetze, 178a. “This heap of stones shall be witness etc.,” that it is comparable to a heap of stones that separates etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This is because the essence of the matter of this screen and curtain is that it is made from the combinations of letters that are called “stones” in Sefer Yetzirah,13Sefer Yetzirah 4:12; Torat Chayim, Bereishit 21d. in which the letters are not properly ordered, are like a heap of stones, one upon the other, and are like the aspect of a screen that is woven of many threads and causes a break and separation.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This is comparable to what we observe with the letters of speech, that when they are properly ordered according to intellect, the light of the intellect clearly radiates within them, so that the recipient is able to understand [the matter] exactly as the influencer [intends].
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: In contrast, when they are not properly ordered, the recipient will not grasp them at all.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: (This is also similar to the light of the intellect and wisdom that is concealed and hidden in an analogy or a riddle about a completely foreign matter. Nonetheless, through it, he is able to come to that intellectual light.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: This too is called a penetration of the screen, similar to the light of the sun as it is seen when its rays break through the thickness of the morning mist, as explained elsewhere.)
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Since there is no comparison between Atzilut and Briyah, therefore there needed to be this aspect of the Tzimtzum of the screen-Masach.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: (This is similar to how there needed to be the aspect of the first Tzimtzum, which is called the empty place and vacant space between the Essential Self of the light of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), to be the source for the drawing down of the Kav-line etc., as previously explained.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Only that there, [in HaShem’s-יהו"ה Essential Self], it was an aspect of concealment and inclusion of the light within His Essential Self, and is called the Empty place (Makom Panuy), rather than an actual screen.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: This was compared to the concealment of one's own expansive knowledge, at a time when he reviews it in summary etc., as discussed previously. This is because all this is still within the aspect of His Essential Self.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: This is not the case from Atzilut to Briyah, because from an aspect of limitlessness to become the source of actual limitation, it is necessary for there to be a screen, in a way of complete separation.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Nevertheless, there is a great benefit in the fact that the screen itself is made by He who made the Tzimtzum-restraint Himself, like a person who [himself] makes the analogy for the analogue, or like one who [intentionally] mixes the order of the letters and the like, because of which, this separation of the screen is not a true break or separation for himself, but only in relation to the recipients.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: This is analogous to a snail whose garment is of himself and part of himself etc.,14See Bereishit Rabba 21:5; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 2, pg. 721. as explained in Tanya.15Tanya, Ch. 21)
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: (This is the meaning of16Isaiah 44:6 “[I am first, and I am last].” That is, “I am first” with the first Tzimtzum of the empty place, and “I am last” is the final Tzimtzum between Atzilut and Briyah etc., because this end action of Atzilut, arose first in the thought and desire of Malchut of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One (Ein Sof) etc. This will suffice for the understanding.)
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Now, as known, this is the root of the matter of, “Blessed be the Name of His glorious Kingship forever and ever etc.,” which is the aspect of the “Lower Unity” (Yichuda Tata'a) of Malchut.17Talmud Bavli, Pesachim 56a; Zohar I 18b.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: That is, it is the radiance of the ten Sefirot of Malchut of Atzilut within Briyah, in the aforementioned aspect of a “glimmer of a glimmer,” as it states, “In your light is light seen etc.”
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Regarding this it states,18Deuteronomy 4:35, 4:39 “HaShem-יהו"ה, He is Elohi”m-אלהי"ם etc.,” and as known regarding the statement,19Zohar Terumah 135a “Just as they are unified above” referring to the union of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah in the aspect of Atzilut, “so likewise is she unified below” referring to Malchut in “the Throne” (which is called) Briyah etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: This then, is what the tribes, who are rooted in the six directions of Briyah, said to Yaakov, who is the master of the world of Atzilut,20Talmud Bavli, Pesachim 56a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 3, pg. 1,063; Shaarei Teshuvah p. 60d. “Just as in your heart there is only One-Echad-אחד” – in the aspect of the upper unity of Atzilut, wherein He and His life force and His organs are one – “So likewise in our hearts there is only One-Echad-אחד,” in the aspect of Malchut of Atzilut, as it is in Briyah in the lower unity.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This is the meaning of21Zachariah 14:9; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereishit pg. 537. “HaShem-יהו״ה is One and His Name is One,” as known.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: In general, this is called22See Zohar III 129a; Zohar III 11a & 11b; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Parshiot HaTorah Vol. 2, pg. 524; Torat Chayim, Noach 64c.HaShem-יהו"ה and Adon”ai-אדנ"י or HaShem-יהו"ה and Elohi”m-אלהי"ם,23See Zohar III 129a; Zohar I 22a; Zohar III 65a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee Vayikra Vol. 1, pg. 307. referring to [how HaShem-יהו"ה] encompasses [and transcends] all worlds (Sovev Kol Almin), and how He permeates all worlds (Memaleh Kol Almin).24See at great length in Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as HaShem Is One, Vol. 1, The Gate of Intrinsic Being (Shaar HaHavayah), The Gate of His Title (Shaar HaKinuy), and The Gate of His Sanctuary (Shaar HaHeichal).
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: These [aspects] are also called by the names Ma”H-מ״ה (יו״ד ה״א וא״ו ה״א) and Ba”N-ב״ן (יו״ד ה״ה ו״ו ה״ה). The name of Ma”H-מ״ה refers to25Etz Chayim, Shaar 17, Ch. 4 Zeir Anpin and the name Ba”N-ב״ן is in Malchut,26Etz Chayim, Shaar 18, Ch. 3; Shaar 29, Ch. 2; Shaar 34, Ch. 2 Klal 13; Shaar 39, Drush 7. as they come forth in a way of expansion (Miluy) and expansion of expansion (Miluy D'Miluy) etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: (The matter of expansions (Miluy) is known by way of example from the letter Yod-י. When it is pronounced (as a word) it has an expansion of Vav and Dalet (Yod-יו"ד), which is the explanation and expansion of the point of the written letter Yod-י.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: And when one needs to explain the expansion of the Vav-ו and Dalet-ד, they too expand into additional letters of Vav-וא”ו and Dalet-דלי”ת. And so on with the expansions of the Vav-וא”ו and Dalet-דלי”ת until there are multiple expansions upon expansions (Miluy D'Miluy) etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: All this is merely the flow and chaining down of the ray of light and influence as it comes in a manner of the specifics of the specifics, from concealment into revelation, and revelation upon revelation, until the final most specific detail.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: This is similar to what is explained elsewhere regarding the matter of, “He spoke three thousand analogies” which are like the multitude of combinations that come in a way of chaining down, one after the other, each one internal to the next, like an analogy to an analogue, that descends and chains down. For, [even] the analogy for this analogue, itself requires an analogy, as stated in the Zohar.27Zohar II 145a; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Parshiot HaTorah, Vol. 1, pg. 350; Torat Chayim Lech Lecha 81d; Also see Sefer HaMashalim of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as The Book of Allegories.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: This is likewise the matter of the expansions (Miluy)28See Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Shacharit 51a; Biurei HaZohar, Tisa 53a and on. that come into revelation from concealment, like a specific detail that comes forth from a general principle etc.
text.1_, 50_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: There is also the aspect of expansion in the opposite sense, in which there is concealment upon concealment, as explained elsewhere that this is the matter of the garment of the screen-Masach etc. This will suffice for the understanding.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, in regard to the aspect of the specifics of the ten Sefirot of Malchut of Atzilut as they are in Briyah after penetrating the screen (Masach), it is known that the aspect of Keter Malchut of Briyah, which is called Atik of Briyah, is what is drawn forth from the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut etc., and is the aspect of the desire and pleasure for the aspect of the source of actual creation (Briyah) of something from nothing.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: This is like the statement,1Zohar I 86b “When it arose in His will to create the world,” for just as it arose in His will to emanate (Atzilut) etc., so likewise His will descended to create something from nothing etc., and this is what is called Keter Malchut of Briyah.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: (This is as explained elsewhere regarding the matter of,2Talmud Bavli, Brachot 7a; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, EtHalech Liozhna pg. 70; Inyanim pg. 382; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereishit pg. 25; Na”Ch p. 599; Drushei Chatunah Vol. 1, pg. 261. “Yishmael my son, bless Me; and he answered Him, “May it be desirable before You etc.” That is, Rabbi Yishmael, the High Priest, was in the Holy of Holies of Briyah-Creation, wherein there descends the light of Malchut of Malchut of Atzilut, to become the Crown (Keter) of Briyah-Creation. He therefore said to him, “My son, bless Me (Barcheini-ברכני)”3The term “Brachah-ברכה” also means “to draw down” (see Mishnah Kilayim 7:1). to which he responded, “may it be desirable before You etc.”)
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: From this pleasure and desire to bring about the creation (Briyah) etc., it was drawn down [further] into Chochmah and Binah of this desire and pleasure, which are called Abba and Imma of Briyah.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: From Abba and Imma, which are the aspects of Chochmah and Binah of this desire and pleasure, the emotions, which are called Zeir Anpin of Briyah, were drawn down.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: From Zeir Anpin [it was drawn down] to Malchut of Briyah, which is the source that brings the world of Briyah, with its souls and angels, into being from nothing into actual something etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Similarly, in the ten Sefirot of Briyah there also is the aspect of lights (Orot) and vessels (Kelim), garments (Levushim) and chambers (Heichalot).
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: This is as known regarding the seven chambers4Etz Chayim, Shaar 40, Drush 13 (Heichalot) of Briyah-Creation;5See Sefer HaMaamarim 5565, pg. 805; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, BaMidbar Vol. 3, pg. 995 and on. that the union of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah occurs in the chamber of the Holy of Holies, which is the seventh chamber6Zohar II (Heichalot) 258b; Etz Chayim, Shaar 46, Ch. 1 & 5 etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: Now, from the aspect of Malchut of Briyah, the aspect of Keter and Atik Yomin of the world of Yetzirah7Etz Chayim, Shaar 46, Ch. 2, 5, and 6. made, and this too is through the penetration of a screen (Masach) between Briyah and Yetzirah, similar to what was previously discussed regarding the screen between Atzilut and Briyah.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: For, just as it arose in His desire to create, so likewise did it arise in his desire to form (Yetzirah) and to actualize (Asiyah), only that it is necessary for there to be a break and a screen between the end action of the desire for Briyah-Creation and the beginning of the desire for Yetzirah-Formation.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This is as it states,8Isaiah 43:7 “For My glory I have created it (Barativ), I have formed it (Yatzartiv), I even have actualized it (Af Asitiv).”
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Now, as known, the [worlds of] Creation-Briyah, Formation-Yetzirah, and Action-Asiyah are called the three separate worlds [that] actually [come into being in a manner of] something from nothing.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: This is similar to the coming into being of the letters of thought, speech and action, which truly come forth in a way of tangible somethingness (Yesh), separate from oneself.9Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Hanachot 5577 pg. 202
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Likewise, from the aspect of the letters of thought of the Godly emotions of Briyah, which is called Zeir Anpin of Briyah, as mentioned above, there was created the aspect of the “hidden worlds that are not revealed,” which are the souls and angels of the world of Briyah, [that are] actually [brought into being in a manner of] something from nothing.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: For example, the soul of,10Isaiah 51:8 “Avraham who loves Me,” is from the aspect of the inner vessels of Chessed of Zeir Anpin of Malchut of [the world of] Briyah,11Tanya, Igeret HaKodesh, Epistle 15; Sefer HaMaamarim 5565 Vol. 2, pg. 276. and [the angel] Michael of the world of Briyah is from the aspect of the externality of the vessels and letters of Chessed of Zeir Anpin of Briyah etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Similarly, the upper garden of Eden (Gan Eden HaElyon) of [the world of] Briyah, is from the aspect of the light of Keter of Briyah, which is the Supernal pleasure that is called Atik of Briyah, as it constricts within Binah of Malchut of Briyah, wherein the souls in Briyah derive pleasure from the ray etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: (As known,12Tikkunei Zohar, Tikkun 6, 23a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 1, pg. 262; Kuntreisim pg. 423. “The supernal mother (Imma) settles in the throne,” which refers to the [descent of the] light of Binah of Atzilut through multitudes of chainings-down until Binah of Malchut of Atzilut [settles] within Binah of Malchut of Briyah etc. In this same manner Zeir Anpin of Atzilut settles in [the world of] Yetzirah,13Tikkunei Zohar, Tikkun 6, 23a; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, HaKtzarim pg. 552; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch, pg. 14. and Malchut settles in [the world of] Asiyah etc.14Tikkunei Zohar, Tikkun 6, 23a)
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: This is likewise the case in regard to the matter of the Serafim [angels] that are in the world of Briyah etc.15Etz Chayim, Shaar 40, Drush 13 They are the,16Or HaTorah, Acharei Vol. 2, pg. 540 “Sons of Elohim who stand before HaShem-יהו"ה,” which is the aspect of Zeir Anpin of [the world of] Briyah.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: The aspect of the vessels of Zeir Anpin of Briyah is the aspect of Metat”ron-מטטרו״ן,17Talmud Bavli, Yevamot 16b in Tosefot; Shaarei Teshuvah 29b. the minister of the world of Briyah,18Zohar III 217a-b, and commentary of Rabbi Chayim Vital there; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch p. 334 about whom it states,19Exodus 23:21; Talmud Bavli, Sanhedrin 38b “For My Name is within him” which is the aspect of Zeir Anpin of [the world of] Atzilut etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: (He is called a lad20See Tosefot to Yevamot 16b referenced above. (Na'ar-נער) or the “small face [or stature]” relative to the “large face [or stature]” of the aspect of Zeir Anpin of Atzilut,21Talmud Bavli, Chagiga 13b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaeee, Dvarim Vol. 3, pg. 901; Kuntreisim pg. 343. as known.)
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: In general, the world of Briyah is called the “World of Thought,” which is the aspect of the concealed worlds etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: (This is similar to [the statement that,22Talmud Bavli, Menachot 29b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bamidbar Vol. 3, p. 1,255.] “The coming world was created with a Yod-י” which refers to the Yod of the thought of Binah of Malchut of Briyah etc., “and with a Heh-ה this world was created” [which refers to] the aspects of Yetzirah and Asiyah.)
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: The world of Yetzirah, however, is the “World of Speech,” that is, the revealed worlds etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: (This is like the [difference between] the prophecies of Isaiah regarding the Serafim [angels] of Briyah, who say,23Isaiah 6:3 “Holy, [Holy, Holy etc,]” and the [prophecies] of Ezekiel regarding the Chayot [angels] and Ophanim [angels] who say, “Blessed [be the Glory of HaShem-יהו״ה from His place] etc.”24Ezekiel 3:12; Talmud Bavli, Chulin 92a and Tosefot there; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Hanachot 5577 pg. 22.)
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: Now, just as it was explained above regarding the ten Sefirot of Briyah, it is the same way with the ten Sefirot of Yetzirah and the ten Sefirot of Asiyah to the finest particulars, with lights and vessels, garments and chambers etc. and the coming into being of angels and souls in Yetzirah; for example [the angel] Sandal”fon-סנדלפו״ן etc.25Etz Chayim, Shaar 47, Ch. 6; Torat Chayim, Vayera 99c.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: For, all the prophecies of the prophets were from the aspects of Netzach and Hod of Zeir Anpin of Yetzirah,26See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch pg. 192. as known.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: And in the same manner there is a screen that separates between Yetzirah and Asiyah,27Etz Chayim, Shaar 42 referenced above. and the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Yetzirah becomes Keter and Atik Yomin for Asiyah, regarding which it states, “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired He did (Asah).”
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: This refers to the souls and angels of [the world of] Asiyah, including the aspect of the lower garden of Eden (Gan Eden HaTachton), until the Ophanim-אופנים angels who receive from the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Asiyah, as known.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: And it is from the aspect of the excretions of the Ophanim angels28See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 2, pg. 484, Torat Chayim, Noach 59d. that influence is drawn down to influence the cycles of the constellations (Mazalot-מזלות), which are the root of all inanimate, plant life, animals and humans, in all climates,29See note of the Rebbe to Sefer HaMaamarim 5708, p. 204 and Igrot Kodesh Vol. 19, p. 239; Also see Ginat Egoz of Rabbi Yosef Gikatilla, translated as HaShem Is One, Vol. 2 & 3 (The Letters of Creation). as well as the root for the composition of the foundational elements of fire, air, water and earth from spirituality to physicality etc.
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This is similar to the statement,30See Shaar HaEmunah 61a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 2, p. 634; Shaarei Teshuva 20a. “A land that cultivates wise [people] etc.,” because [it receives from] the Mazal of Machkim [Chochmah-Wisdom] etc.,31Talmud Bavli, Shabbat 156a or [the verse,32Deuteronomy 33:14] “The choice fruits of the sun etc.,” to the point that there is even a Mazal for inanimate objects, as in [the statement],33Talmud Bavli, Chulin 40a “the luck of the mountain,” until there is even a Mazal for the inanimate of the inanimate, as it states,34Bereishit Rabba 10:6; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 3, pg. 848 & 876 and on. “There is not a blade of grass that does not have its Mazal.”
text.1_, 51_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: The constellations (Mazalot) are ruled by the aspect of Malchut of Malchut of Asiyah, as known regarding the verse,35Psalms 103:19 “His Kingdom rules over all etc.,” and as stated,36Psalms 145:13; Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Shacharit p. 53d. “[Your Kingdom is the Kingdom of all worlds” and “Your dominion [is throughout all ages”] etc., as will be explained with the help of HaShem-יהו"ה.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now after all the above, a person who contemplates it, will understand the general point of the entire Hitbonenut – contemplation, from the simple essential desire [that arose] in the actual Essence of the Light of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One, because of the aspect of the essential desire for kindness that arose in His simple will (as discussed in chapter ten) etc., all the way to the aspect of the most final desire, which is the aspect of the desire to bring the world of Asiyah-Actuality into being, both generally and specifically, and is called Keter and Atik Yomin of Asiyah, regarding which it states, “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired, He did (Asah).”
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: For certainly, just as it arose in His desire to have a desire and will to emanate [Atzilut], so likewise the desire and will to create [Briyah] and the desire and will to form [Yetzirah] and the desire and will to do [Asiyah], were all included in the Essence of His simple will in His Essential Self.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: For example, this is just as when it arises in a person’s essential desire to have a desire for some specific matter; although this desire immediately divides into multiple desires from level to level, until the most final desire, which is the desire for the actual final action, nonetheless, it all arose instantaneously within his essential will etc., without divisions of levels whatsoever.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: (This was explained in chapter seven, that there is no division of levels in the aspect of the Keter of the worlds of Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah, even though in the chaining down, the aspect of the Malchut of the upper level becomes the Keter of the lower level etc.)
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Likewise, relative to the essence of His simple will in the aspect of the Essence of the light of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), blessed is He, there is no differentiation of levels between the desire and will to emanate (Atzilut) and the desire and will to do (Asiyah) etc.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is the meaning of,1Isaiah 44:6 “I am first,” in the desire of Malchut of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), blessed is He, which is the source for the desire to emanate (Atzilut), and “I am last,” in the most final desire of Malchut of the world of Action (Asiyah), to bring into being the most lowly and final world, which are the Ophanim [angels] and the Mazalot, that are the root for the existence of the spirituality of the four elements of fire, air, water and earth, and the spirituality of the physical levels of inanimate, plant life and animals.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: (This is as stated at the end of Etz Chayim), that everything is included in the verse, “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired” – in His Essential Self – “He did,” which includes the entire chaining down of the Kav-line until the end of the world of Asiyah; that is, He includes them all.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: [Relative to Him] it all is considered to be an action (Asiyah), because relative to His Essential Self the root of Atzilut and the root of Asiyah are literally equal, etc.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: This then, is the meaning [of the continuation of the verse, “Everything that HaShem-יהו"ה desired He did] in the Heavens,” referring to the general encompassing light (Sovev) of the upper purity (Tihiru Ila'ah), “and in the earth,” referring to the aspect of how He fills all worlds (Memaleh Kol Almin) in the lower purity (Tihiru Ta'taa) etc.2See Likkutei Torah, Naso 21c; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Hanachot 5577 pg. 329; Kuntreisim pg. 593; Torat Chayim Vayigash 230d; Shaar HaEmunah 58a. It all is equally one [before Him].
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: (This is as known that the heel of Adam Kadmon concludes at the end of Asiyah3See Tanya, Igeret HaKodesh, Epistle 20; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 1 pg. 15. and his head is in the general thought at the beginning of the Kav (As it says about Adam HaRishon-The first man, that prior to the sin his feet were in Asiyah and his head was in Briyah),4Sefer HaGilgulim, Ch. 18; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Bereishit pg. 72; Vayikra Vol. 1 pg. 15, Bamidbar Vol. 4 pg. 1,456; Torat Chayim Bereishit 30a. but Adam Kadmon [is nevertheless] called Adam of Briyah,5See Maamarei Admor HaZaken, beginning of Inyanim that is, [created] something from nothing etc.)
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: (This is [also] the meaning of,6Shacharit prayer of Shabbat and Yom Tov; Torat Chayim Bereishit 30a. “Every stature shall bow before You etc.,” as discussed elsewhere.)
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This then, is the primary intention of the entire contemplation of every detail within the chaining down of the Kav-line, from before the first Tzimtzum-restraint until the end of the world of Asiyah. That is, [the intention] is to unite everything in the simple unity, which is in the aspect of the Essence of the light of the Singular Preexistent Intrinsic Being, HaShem-יהו״ה, the Unlimited One, blessed is He, until the order of HaShem’s-יהו"ה Godly supervision of every detail, is engrained in one’s soul, even to the very last detail.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: That is, even in the world of the planetary cycles and constellations (Mazalot), that only come from the nine external vessels of Malchut of Malchut of Asiyah, [one must recognize] that it literally is only according to His simple will within the Essential Self of the light of HaShem-יהו"ה, the Unlimited One (Ein Sof), blessed is He.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: This is as we say [in our prayers],7Aravit prayer; Also see Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee Hanachot 5577 pg. 53, 67, 90, 163, 330. “He – specifically – orders the stars in their watches within the firmament according to His will,” that is, literally according to His simple will in His Essential Self, for the aforementioned reason.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: The explanation of, “in their watches,” refers8See Shaarei Teshuva 20a even to the aspect of the chambers of the husks of Kelipat Nogah of Asiyah; because the constellations (Mazalot) that are fixed in the heavens, are in the aspect of Nogah of Asiyah.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: This is because the ten Sefirot of Asiyah in its aspect of lights, vessels and chambers etc., are all in an aspect of total nullification of the something (Bitul HaYesh) to the nothing (Ein) [from which they are brought into being], as known regarding the chamber of the Holy of Holies in Asiyah, where there is the union of Zeir Anpin and Nukvah of Asiyah, such as in the Holy Temple below etc.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Even the souls and angels of Asiyah are in a state of total nullification, as it states,9Nechemiah 9:6 “The hosts of the heavens bow to You,” referring to the Ophanim and Chayot [angels] of Asiyah.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Even the substance and vessels of the Ophanim are in an aspect of absolute nullification, as understood from the chariot [prophecy] of Ezekiel regarding the Chayot and Ophanim [angels] of Yetzirah.10Ezekiel Ch. 1
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Similarly, this is the case regarding the chariot of black and red horses of Zachariah's11Zachariah 6:2 [prophecy, which refers to] times of exile, in which Malchut is vested within the seventy ministering angels12Zohar Bereishit 46b; Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Shaar HaMilah 145c; Shaarei Teshuvah 74a. of Nogah of Asiyah. They too are in a state of total nullification, like a horse to its rider.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: This is as stated,13Isaiah 19:1 “Behold HaShem-יהו"ה rides upon a swift cloud-עב קל etc.,” and as explained in the Zohar,14Zohar II 43a that they are, “like a cloud upon which He rides etc.” This is similar to the verse,15Isaiah 10:15 “Can an axe glory over the One who chops with it etc.”
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Even though there are many different levels in them, with numerous chainings-down, even those who receive through a multitude of screens, in an aspect of the back of the back of Elohi״m-אלהי״ם, from the forty-eight (מ”ח) last combinations [of Elohi”m-אלהי״ם] which is called,16Blessing of “Emet V'Emunah”; Pri Etz Chayim, Shaar Chag HaMatzot, Shaar 21, Ch. 5; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 1, pg. 327; Devarim Vol. 3, pg. 1,061; Shaar HaEmunah 30a & 49a. “the land of the children of Cham (ח”ם-48),” in a way of ultimate concealment and Tzimtzum-restraint with various different types of screens and separations, so much so, that it is called a garment of sackcloth and skin, as in the verse,17Isaiah 50:3; Also see Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Milah 45c; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 2 pg. 896. “I will enclothe the heavens with darkness and I will put sackcloth as their covering etc.,” as known, and as stated,18Havdalah prayer; Shaarei Teshuva 113c “He who separates etc.” Nonetheless it states,19Psalms 47:9 “God reigns over the nations etc.,” and,20Jeremiah 10:7 “Who will not fear You, O King of the nations etc.,” for,21Psalms 103:19 “His kingdom rules over all.”
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Proof of this is from Bilaam, who was the, “evil aspect of Nogah” (Ra D’Nogah), the aspect of Da'at of the external husks22Zohar III 194a; Etz Chayim, Shaar 32, Ch. 2; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 2, p. 643. (Kelipah), as it states,23Numbers 24:16 “he who knows the knowledge of the Most High (Yodeah Da'at Elyon) etc.” Nevertheless, even he said,24Numbers 24:13 “I cannot transgress the word of HaShem-יהו"ה to do even the smallest thing etc.”
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: (Even his donkey, which was the aspect of Nukvah of Zeir Anpin of the Kelipah – the female of Zeir Anpin of the external husks,25Zohar III 107a; MeOrei Or, Erech Aton num. 138. which is even more severe (for as will be explained about the opposite of holiness (Sitra Achera),26Ecclesiastes 7:14; Biurei HaZohar, Pekudei 59b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Shemot Vol. 2, pg. 495; Shaarei Teshuvah 69a. the aspect of the female-Nukvah is the most severe of them all27Zohar III 231b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch pg. 33. etc.), [However even about his donkey] it states,28Numbers 22:23 “and his donkey turned away [from the angel of HaShem-יהו״ה] etc.,” and even Bilaam said,29Numbers 22:34 “If it displeases You, I shall return etc.”)
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Now, although there are those [Kelipot-husks] that are in an aspect of total somethingness and separation, so much so, that they say,30Deuteronomy 8:17 “My power and the strength of my hand [brought me all this affluence] etc., such as the ministering angel of Egypt who said,31Ezekiel 29:3; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Hanachot 5577, pg. 275; Bamidbar Vol. 2, pg. 814. “My river is mine and I made myself etc.” and as the sages, of blessed memory, have stated,32Torat Kohanim to Leviticus 26:14; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereishit pg. 98 “They know their master and intentionally rebel against Him.” These are from the aspect of the three totally impure husks (Kelipot), and they too submit at times, when HaShem-יהו"ה visits punishment upon them.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: This is as explained about the various prophecies of the prophets regarding some of the ministering angels of the idolatrous nations of the world etc.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: However, in the aspect of Nogah, even the aspect of Nogah of Asiyah, which is mostly evil with a minority of good,33Etz Chayim, Shaar 43, introduction; Shaar 47, Ch. 4; Shaar 49, Ch. 6. they are in a state of constant submission, such as the planets and constellations, that are [influenced by] the seventy ministering angels about whom it also states, “The hosts of the heavens bow down to You,” and “They sing His praise every day” etc.34See Torat Chayim, Bereishit 1c.
text.1_, 52_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: As known, this is in accordance with the reason for the constant orbit of the physical planets [and constellations] that this is due only to their forms and souls being in a constant state of praising and spiritual bowing to HaShem-יהו"ה etc., as explained elsewhere. This will suffice for the understanding.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Now, in order to understand the chaining down of the “opposite side” in a detailed manner etc., in regard to the ten Sefirot of the husks of Kelipah of Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah etc., we must first preface with the root of the aspect of the Kelipah-husks and understand what it is.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Now, it is known that the reason it is called by the name Kelipah-husks, is because it is likened to the husk of a fruit, which is the dross of each thing that comes about because of the admixture of good and bad etc. due to the shattering of the vessels etc. of the seven kings [of Tohu] who died and fell below etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: The husk precedes the fruit,1Zohar II 108b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 1, p. 209. just as in the growth of any fruit, the peel always grows first. This is like the relationship of the placenta to the fetus, which comes about from the dross of the seminal drop etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Now, the root of these matters is known; that even within the aspect of pleasure, there is the aspect of its opposite. This is pain which is the opposite of pleasure, just as the letters Nega-plague-נגע are the opposite of the letters Oneg-pleasure-ענג.2Sefer Yetzirah 2:4 and the commentaries there; Also see Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Kuntreisim p. 210; Shaar HaTeshuvah 53d.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: (Similarly, Pesha-transgression-פשע is the opposite letters of Shefa-abundance-שפע.3Zohar III (Idra Rabba) 133a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol.1, p. 307; Torat Chayim Bereishit 28b.)
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: This is because certainly, everything that comes into an aspect of spreading forth from the essence, has its opposing power, which also comes from the essence.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Therefore, even the aspect of the spreading forth of the light of pleasure and desire has an opposing power that opposes it. For example, this is when one is prevented from delighting in that pleasure. Likewise, if there is something in opposition, which is the opposite of that pleasure, it is called pain and suffering etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Likewise, within the wisdom and reason for the pleasure and desire there automatically is an opposing reason that opposes the desire. This is likewise so of emotions and thought, speech and action etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: This is like a servant who transgresses and opposes the will of his master. In doing so, he opposes all the particulars included in the will [of his master] etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Similarly, [it states,4Ecclesiastes 7:14] “God made one thing opposite the other etc.,” so that there should be an aspect of opposition. This is called the dross (Pesolet), the husk (Kelipah) and the concealment that preceded at first etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: This comes about by means of the aspect of the Tzimtzum and concealment that precedes all light and influence of desire, pleasure and wisdom etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: This is like [the verse,5Psalms 7:11] “Who knows the strength of Your anger and Your wrath is like the fear due You etc.” This is the aspect of the opposition to the desire. It is there that anger and wrath are applicable to those who oppose and transgress the will etc., until,6Jeremiah 23:19 & 30:23 “The wrath of HaShem-יהו"ה shall rest upon the heads of the wicked etc.”
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: (This is as explained elsewhere about the matter of, “At first there was darkness [and then the light returned],” therefore,7See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereshit p. 179; Torat Chayim, Vayishlach 185a. “The insolent amongst the nations of the world are powerful at first etc.”)
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Now, it is known that the principal shattering [which brought about] an admixture of actual good and evil, was in the aspect of Sa”G-ס״ג (יו״ד ה״י וא״ו ה״י), which is the aspect of the seven lower Sefirot of Binah.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: These are the aspect of the emotions of the intellect that give rise to the emotions of the heart, including bad emotions, such as anger, murderousness, evil lusts, evil love and fear, conquest and boastfulness for [the sake of] evil etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: However, in Chochmah there was no shattering.8Etz Chayim, Shaar 8, Ch. 2, Ch. 3, Ch. 6 Rather, only the externality of Abba and Imma fell,9Etz Chayim, Shaar 8, Ch. 2, Ch. 3, Ch. 6; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 3, pg. 1,116. this being the root of external wisdoms [and sciences].10See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 1, pg. 9; Vol. 4, pg. 1,225; Na”Ch pg. 365; Sefer HaMaamarim 5649, pg. 267.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Now, [in Chochmah] too there is the matter of [the verses],11Proverbs 8:12; See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 2, pg. 532; Torat Chayim, Noach pg. 79a “I am wisdom, I dwell with craftiness,” or,12Deuteronomy 8:12; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Devarim Vol. 4, pg. 1,496. “My father was [nearly] destroyed by the Aramite,” which refers to Chochmah of the Kelipah-husks, that is only for the sake of wickedness, as in,13Jeremiah 4:22 “They are wise to do evil,” but not to do good whatsoever. This is not true Chochmah-wisdom, but rather only craftiness and falsehood, as known.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Even from the aspect of the “Supernal Pleasure,” the aspect of its externality was lowered.14Etz Chayim, Shaar 8, Ch. 3; Shaar 9, Ch. 2. This is the root for the existence of the pleasures of this world.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Nevertheless, the principal aspect of evil is in the emotions, which branched far down into the husks (Kelipah) of Asiyah.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: These are the wicked accusers who carry out actual evil, whose very [pleasure] in life is only to kill, like agents of death etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Below in this world, these are destructive creatures, such as snakes or predatory beasts etc., whereas in mankind these are the murderers.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Therefore, regarding the coming future when evil will be negated, it states,15Isaiah 11:9 & 65:25 “They will neither injure nor destroy [in all of My sacred mountain; for the earth will be filled with the knowledge of HaShem-יהו״ה as the water covers the ocean bed],” because then, the remnants of the seven kings [of Tohu], that have not yet been rectified, will have been purified, as known.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Now, in the “other side” of Kelipah there [also] is an aspect of the form of man. He is called, “Man without a yoke-Adam Bleeya’al-אדם בליעל,” and is the aspect of Zeir Anpin of Kelipah, like it states,16Genesis 32:25; Shaar HaTeshuvah 49c “And there wrestled a man with him etc.”
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: This is the aspect of the emotions with the intellect of Abba and Imma of the Kelipah-husks, including the aspect of Keter and Atik Yomin of Kelipah, which is called the depth of evil (Omek Ra),17Sefer Yetzirah 1:5; Shaar HaTeshuvah Vol. 1, pg. 4a. because it is the depth of the desire and pleasure for all wickedness, which is the source for all wicked desire.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: In the Zohar these are called,18Zohar III 41b; 70a;143a-b. the “Crowns of Impurity - Kitrin D'Mesavoota” and in the terminology of the Talmud they are called,19See also Shaar HaTeshuva Vol. 1, pg. 4b “The gates of impurity etc.”
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Now generally, there is the aspect of the ten Sefirot of Kelipat Nogah in [each world] of Atzilut, Briyah, Yetzirah and Asiyah.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: However, in the aspect of Nogah of Atzilut there is no evil whatsoever, as it states,20Psalms 5:5; Maamarei Admor HaZaken, Parshiot HaTorah Vol. 2, pg. 829; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch pg. 191. “Evil shall not dwell with You etc.” Rather, it is the aspect of, “the sense of somethingness,” which is very pronounced and felt, such as the aspect of a person’s awareness of his own kindness, in that he glories in the kind deeds that he does.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: Similarly, in regard to Chochmah, this is when he is very aware of his own wisdom. The same holds true of all one’s qualities and positive qualities. He knows and is aware of them in a very pronounced way.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: What branches out as a result of this, leads to an aspect of actual evil. For example, in one who feels himself to be kind, there will branch out kindness that is only for his own self-aggrandizement and benefit, such as the kindness of Ishmael21See Siddur Im Divrei Elokim Chayim, Shaar HaSukkot pg. 259c; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Na”Ch pg. 534. and the like.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: This then, is an example of the chaining down of Nogah of Briyah, which branches out from Nogah of Atzilut, in that, all in all, it has a minority of evil,22See the previous chapter. which is the aspect of doing something for one’s own benefit, with the pride and haughtiness of a “something-Yesh,” separate and apart [from HaShem-יהו"ה] etc.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: (For example, because of fervor during prayer, which is pronounced, in that he is aware of himself, a person will become angered against anyone who opposes him, to the point of striking and pursuing him, if his honor is slighted.)
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: Similarly, it states that,23Talmud Bavli, Bava Batra 16a; See Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Vayikra Vol. 2, p. 476. “Satan and Peninah’s intentions were for the sake of heaven” – which is the aspect of Nogah of Atzilut – however, “he set his eyes on the first Temple and destroyed it.”24Talmud Bavli, Sukkah 52a; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Bereshit pg. 98.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: This was from the aspect of the envy of the primordial snake,25Talmud Bavli, Sanhedrin 59b; Maamarei Admor HaEmtzaee, Hanachot 5577, pg. 231; Torat Chayim, Bereishit 33a & 16a. [which is] the aspect of, “somethingness for the sake of oneself,” with a minority of evil, even though this envy came about because of his recognition and closeness, as [it states],26Talmud Bavli, Avoda Zarah 55a “Envy applies primarily [when the wise envies the wise, the mighty envies the mighty and the wealthy envies the wealthy] etc.”
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Nogah of Yetzirah however, is half evil, with actual accusations, as it states,27Job 1:6 (2:1) “And the Satan also came [amongst them] etc., and he said,28Job 1:9 ‘does Iyov fear God without personal benefit etc.?’”
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: [It then descends further] until the aspect of Nogah of Asiyah, which is mostly evil, to actualize every harsh judgment, which literally is its vitality.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: This is called,29See Introduction to Zohar 11b. “An evil whip with which to smite etc.” Moreover, it is like a leech that draws out the dross of the blood etc., as it states,30Proverbs 30:15; Talmud Bavli, Avodah Zarah 17a “The leech has [two daughters called] give, give etc.” This is the root of the aspect of hell (Gehinom) that will, “rest upon the heads of the wicked,”31Talmud Bavli, Chagigah 13b as known.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Now, the three impure Kelipot-husks are like the snake, serpent and scorpion in the, “desert of the nations.”32Deuteronomy 8:15; Likkutei Torah, Naso 20a; Shaar HaTeshuvah Vol. 1, p. 4b.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: [This is] the aspect of Keter of Kelipah, which is completely evil without any admixture of good whatsoever.
text.1_, 53_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: This is called33Talmud Bavli, Brachot 7a; Tanya Ch. 11 a “Rasha v'Ra Lo - A wicked one who has bad,” for which as of yet, there is no rectification whatsoever, but rather, only in the future, about which it states,34Zachariah 13:2 “I will – completely - remove the spirit of impurity” etc., as known. This will suffice for the understanding.
